data.footnotes: [17] It is believed that this verse came in response to the Jews who claimed that after the Lord made the heavens and the earth in six days, He rested on the seventh day. See Exodus 31:17.

data.price: So bear patiently [O Prophet] what they say, and glorify the praise of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset[18].
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ قَبۡلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمۡسِ وَقَبۡلَ ٱلۡغُرُوبِ
data.footnotes: [18] This and the following verse refer to the times of the five daily prayers; before the sun rises and sets (i.e., the Fajr, Zuhr, and ‘Asr prayers).

data.price: And glorify Him in the night[19] and after the prayers.
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَأَدۡبَٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ
data.footnotes: [19] The night (the Maghrib, ‘Isha’ prayers).

data.price: And listen! On the Day when the Caller will call out from a nearby place[20],
data.arabic: وَٱسۡتَمِعۡ يَوۡمَ يُنَادِ ٱلۡمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٖ قَرِيبٖ
data.footnotes: [20] The angel who will blow the second trumpet for the Resurrection.

data.price: the Day when they will hear the Blast [of the second Trumpet] in truth[21]. That is the Day of Resurrection.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَسۡمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيۡحَةَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُرُوجِ
data.footnotes: [21] See footnote below 50:20.

data.price: Indeed, it is We Who give life and cause death, and to Us is the final return.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نُحۡيِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيۡنَا ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

data.price: On the Day when the earth will be rent asunder for them as they hasten forth [from their graves]; that is an easy gathering for Us.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ عَنۡهُمۡ سِرَاعٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشۡرٌ عَلَيۡنَا يَسِيرٞ

data.price: We know best what they say, and you are not there to compel them to believe. But remind with the Qur’an those who fear My warning.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِجَبَّارٖۖ فَذَكِّرۡ بِٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ

data.price: By the winds that scatter [dust],
data.arabic: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَٰتِ ذَرۡوٗا

data.price: and by the clouds carrying loads of water,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡحَٰمِلَٰتِ وِقۡرٗا

data.price: and by the ships that sail with ease,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡجَٰرِيَٰتِ يُسۡرٗا

data.price: and by the angels who distribute [blessings] by His command.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَٰتِ أَمۡرًا

data.price: Indeed, what you are promised is true,
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٞ

data.price: and the Judgment will surely come to pass.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: By the heaven with its pathways[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., tracks or orbits.

data.price: Indeed, you [Makkans] have conflicting views[2].
data.arabic: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِي قَوۡلٖ مُّخۡتَلِفٖ
data.footnotes: [2] Concerning the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Qur’an.

data.price: He who is diverted from it is destined to be diverted.
data.arabic: يُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ

data.price: Doomed[3] are those who base their beliefs on conjecture.
data.arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّٰصُونَ
data.footnotes: [3] May they be destroyed.

data.price: those who are steeped in ignorance heedlessly.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ سَاهُونَ

data.price: They ask [mockingly], “When is the Day of Judgment?”
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: It is the Day when they will be punished by the Fire.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفۡتَنُونَ

data.price: [It will be said], “Taste your punishment! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”
data.arabic: ذُوقُواْ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ

data.price: receiving what their Lord will give them, for they were indeed doers of good beforehand.
data.arabic: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: They used to sleep only a little at night[4],
data.arabic: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., spending most of the night in prayer, reciting the Qur’an, and in supplication.

data.price: and before dawn they would seek forgiveness[5],
data.arabic: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [5] Supererogatory prayers and supplications are recommended before dawn.

data.price: and in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the destitute.
data.arabic: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ

data.price: On earth there are signs for those who are certain in faith,
data.arabic: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ

data.price: and also within yourselves. Do you not see?
data.arabic: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: And in the heaven is your provision and all that you are promised.
data.arabic: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ

data.price: By the Lord of the heaven and earth, this [resurrection] is certainly as true as the fact that you can speak.
data.arabic: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ

data.price: Has there come to you the story of Abraham’s honored guests[6]?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [6] Honorable angels with Allah.

data.price: When they came to him and said, “Peace.” He said, “Upon you be peace.” [saying to himself] “Unknown people!”
data.arabic: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ

data.price: Then he went quickly to his household, and came with a fat [roasted] calf,
data.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ

data.price: and placed it before them and said, “Will you not eat?”
data.arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ

data.price: He felt apprehensive about them[7]. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.
data.arabic: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [7] In their culture, if a guest refused to eat the food provided, it was considered a sign of ill will. See footnote 11:70.

data.price: His wife cried out loud, and struck her face [in astonishment] and said, “[I am] a barren old woman!”
data.arabic: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ

data.price: They said, “This is what your Lord said. Indeed, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ

data.price: Abraham said, “Then what is your mission, O messengers?”
data.arabic: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people,
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: to send down upon them stones of clay,
data.arabic: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ

data.price: marked by your Lord for the transgressors.”
data.arabic: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ

data.price: We brought out those believers who were there,
data.arabic: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: but We only found in it one Muslim household[8].
data.arabic: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
data.footnotes: [8] Lot's family except his wife.

data.price: And We left there a sign[9] for those who fear the painful punishment.
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., the ruins of Sodom or the Dead Sea in Palestine, as a lesson for people.

data.price: And [there is a sign in the story of] Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with compelling proofs,
data.arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: But he and his supporters turned away, and he said about [Moses], “A magician or a madman!”
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ

data.price: So We seized him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea while he was blameworthy[10].
data.arabic: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [10] For his disbelief and arrogance.

data.price: And [there is a sign in the story of] ‘Ād, when We sent against them the devastating barren wind[11].
data.arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ
data.footnotes: [11] Devoid of all goodness such as carrying rain or fertilizing trees.

data.price: It spared nothing it came upon except that it reduced it to ruin and decay.
data.arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ

data.price: And [there is a sign in the story of] Thamūd, when they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while[12].”
data.arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., only three days. See 11:65.

data.price: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them, while they were looking on.
data.arabic: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: They could not withstand it, nor could they ward it off.
data.arabic: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ

data.price: And the people of Noah [were also destroyed] before them. They were indeed a rebellious people.
data.arabic: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ

data.price: We built the heaven with might[13], and We are indeed expanding it.
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [13] ’Ayd does not mean "hands" here. This is not from the verses of Allah's attributes, for Allah Almighty did not add it to Himself, i.e., He did not say, "My ’ayd, or Our ’ayd".

data.price: And We spread out the earth. How well did We smooth it out[14]!
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] The earth was spread out to accommodate the creatures. Its spherical shape is mentioned in 39:5.

data.price: And We have created everything in pairs[15], so that you may take heed.
data.arabic: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ
data.footnotes: [15] Such as day and night, male and female, light and darkness, sweet and bitter, hot and cold, etc.

data.price: So flee to Allah[16]. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.
data.arabic: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
data.footnotes: [16] From His punishment to His reward by shunning disbelief and sin and by obeying Him.

data.price: And do not set up another god with Allah. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.”
data.arabic: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them without being told: “A magician, or a madman!”
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ

data.price: Did they suggest this to one another[17]? Rather they are transgressing people.
data.arabic: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
data.footnotes: [17] i.e., Did the previous disbelievers pass on these false allegations to the pagans of Makkah so they repeat their words?

data.price: So turn away from them [O Prophet], for you are not to blame[18].
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ
data.footnotes: [18] After you have delivered the message.

data.price: But keep reminding them, for reminder benefits the believers.
data.arabic: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: I have not created the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
data.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ

data.price: I seek no provision from them, nor do I want them to feed Me.
data.arabic: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ

data.price: Indeed, it is Allah Who is the All-Provider[19], Lord of Power, the Mighty.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ
data.footnotes: [19] He Provides His creatures with everything they need. Among His provisions is guidance.

data.price: Indeed, those who do wrong will have a share [of punishment] like that of their predecessors, so let them not ask Me to hasten it.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ

data.price: So woe to those who disbelieve from [the punishment of] the Day which they are promised.
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: By the mount of Tūr[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلطُّورِ
data.footnotes: [1] Where Allah Almighty communicated with Moses (عليه السلام).

data.price: and by the Book inscribed[2]
data.arabic: وَكِتَٰبٖ مَّسۡطُورٖ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., the Qur’an.

data.price: on an unrolled parchment[3],
data.arabic: فِي رَقّٖ مَّنشُورٖ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., a spread-out scroll.

data.price: and by the much-frequented House[4],
data.arabic: وَٱلۡبَيۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡمُورِ
data.footnotes: [4] Which is frequented by angels or the Ka‘bah in Makkah which is frequented by pilgrims.

data.price: and by the canopy raised high,
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّقۡفِ ٱلۡمَرۡفُوعِ

data.price: and by the sea set on fire[5].
data.arabic: وَٱلۡبَحۡرِ ٱلۡمَسۡجُورِ
data.footnotes: [5] On the Day of Resurrection, or "by the overflowed sea."

data.price: The punishment of your Lord will surely come to pass;
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: there is none who can avert it.
data.arabic: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٖ

data.price: On the Day when the heaven will convulse violently[6],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوۡرٗا
data.footnotes: [6] The heavens will be shaken violently, indicating the occurrence of the Hour. The word "maur" originally means turning round, rotating, swinging, swaying, etc.

data.price: and the mountains will move a horrible movement[7].
data.arabic: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ سَيۡرٗا
data.footnotes: [7] They will turn into dust, moving as clouds.

data.price: Then woe to the deniers on that Day,
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: those who amuse themselves in falsehood.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي خَوۡضٖ يَلۡعَبُونَ

data.price: On the Day when they will be shoved into the Fire forcefully,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

data.price: [They will be told,] “This is the Fire which you used to deny.
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: Is this [punishment] magic, or do you not see?
data.arabic: أَفَسِحۡرٌ هَٰذَآ أَمۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: Burn in it, whether you bear it patiently or impatiently, it makes no difference to you[8]; you are recompensed only for what you used to do.”
data.arabic: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا فَٱصۡبِرُوٓاْ أَوۡ لَا تَصۡبِرُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ إِنَّمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
data.footnotes: [8] He who is patient during afflictions in the life of this world will be rewarded. As for the Hereafter, suffering patiently in Hell will not bring any reward or benefit.

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and bliss,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَعِيمٖ

data.price: enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: “Eat and drink pleasantly for what you used to do,
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: reclining on couches all lined up”. And We will marry them to houris with wide beautiful eyes.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّصۡفُوفَةٖۖ وَزَوَّجۡنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٖ

data.price: As for those who believe and their offspring follow them in faith, We will cause their offspring to join them, and will not detract anything from [the reward of] their deeds. Everyone will be accountable for what he earned[9].
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَٱتَّبَعَتۡهُمۡ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَٰنٍ أَلۡحَقۡنَا بِهِمۡ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ وَمَآ أَلَتۡنَٰهُم مِّنۡ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيۡءٖۚ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيِٕۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٞ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., None will be held responsible for the burden of another.

data.price: And We will provide them with whatever fruit and meat they desire.
data.arabic: وَأَمۡدَدۡنَٰهُم بِفَٰكِهَةٖ وَلَحۡمٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: They will pass around to one another a glass [of pure wine] which does not lead to idle talk or sin.
data.arabic: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا لَّا لَغۡوٞ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمٞ

data.price: They will be served by their servant boys, as if they were well-protected pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ غِلۡمَانٞ لَّهُمۡ كَأَنَّهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ

data.price: They will turn to one another with questions[10].
data.arabic: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
data.footnotes: [10] They will probably ask one another about their worldly lives and what led them to Paradise.

data.price: They will say, “Before this, we used to be in awe [of Allah] when we were living among our people.
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبۡلُ فِيٓ أَهۡلِنَا مُشۡفِقِينَ

data.price: Therefore Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.
data.arabic: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ

data.price: Indeed, we used to call upon Him before. He is indeed the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.”
data.arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبۡلُ نَدۡعُوهُۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: So keep exhorting [O Prophet], for you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٖ وَلَا مَجۡنُونٍ

data.price: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await a misfortune[11]”?
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٞ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيۡبَ ٱلۡمَنُونِ
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., inevitable death or so.

data.price: Say, “Wait, I too am waiting with you.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ تَرَبَّصُواْ فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُتَرَبِّصِينَ

data.price: Do their minds[12] prompt them to say such things, or are they transgressing people?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَأۡمُرُهُمۡ أَحۡلَٰمُهُم بِهَٰذَآۚ أَمۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
data.footnotes: [12] The leaders of pagans in Makkah claimed to be of great minds. Here it questions their intelligence, arguing that a man cannot be a madman and a poet at the same time.

data.price: Or do they say, “He has made this [Qur’an] up”? Rather, they are not willing to believe.
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥۚ بَل لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: Then let them produce a discourse like this, if they are truthful[13].
data.arabic: فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِحَدِيثٖ مِّثۡلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [13] Arab pagans were challenged to produce the like of this Quran, ten surahs, or one surah, but the challenge has never been met until the present day. See 2:23, 11:13, 52:34.

data.price: Were they created by none, or were they the creators [of themselves]?
data.arabic: أَمۡ خُلِقُواْ مِنۡ غَيۡرِ شَيۡءٍ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ

data.price: Or did they create the heavens and earth? Rather, they are not certain in faith.
data.arabic: أَمۡ خَلَقُواْ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ

data.price: Or do they possess the treasures of your Lord, or do they have full control [of everything]?
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡمُصَۜيۡطِرُونَ

data.price: Or do they have a stairway [to the heaven] by which they eavesdrop? Then let those who eavesdrop produce a compelling proof.
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ سُلَّمٞ يَسۡتَمِعُونَ فِيهِۖ فَلۡيَأۡتِ مُسۡتَمِعُهُم بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: Or does He have daughters while you have sons[14]?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡبَنَٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] See footnote 37:149.

data.price: Or are you asking them [O Prophet] for a reward so they are overburdened by debt?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ

data.price: Or do they have [the knowledge of] the unseen so they are writing it down?
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبُ فَهُمۡ يَكۡتُبُونَ

data.price: Or do they intend a plot [against the Prophet]? But the plot of the disbelievers will rebound against themselves.
data.arabic: أَمۡ يُرِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗاۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡمَكِيدُونَ

data.price: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah far above what they associate with Him.
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ إِلَٰهٌ غَيۡرُ ٱللَّهِۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ

data.price: If they were to see pieces of the sky falling down[15], they would still say, “[This is only] a mass of clouds.”
data.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ كِسۡفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطٗا يَقُولُواْ سَحَابٞ مَّرۡكُومٞ
data.footnotes: [15] As a sign of the punishment that they requested.

data.price: So leave them alone until they encounter their Day in which they will be struck down[16],
data.arabic: فَذَرۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي فِيهِ يُصۡعَقُونَ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., they will be punished on the Day of Judgment.

data.price: the Day their plots will not avail them in the least, nor will they be helped.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُمۡ كَيۡدُهُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ

data.price: And for the wrongdoers, there will be another punishment before that[17], but most of them do not know.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ عَذَابٗا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [17] In this world such as famine, droughts, or defeat at the battle, or punishment in the grave.

data.price: Be patient [O Prophet] with your Lord’s decree, for indeed you are under Our [Watchful] Eyes. And glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.
data.arabic: وَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَاۖ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

data.price: And glorify Him at night and when the stars fade away[18].
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَإِدۡبَٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
data.footnotes: [18] i.e., the early hours of the morning when the stars set; the time of the Fajr Prayer.

data.price: By the star when it sets,
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّجۡمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ

data.price: Your companion [i.e., the Prophet] has neither strayed nor is he deluded.
data.arabic: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمۡ وَمَا غَوَىٰ

data.price: Nor does he speak out of his own desire.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰٓ

data.price: It is but a revelation sent down [to him].
data.arabic: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحۡيٞ يُوحَىٰ

data.price: He was taught by [an angel of] mighty power[1],
data.arabic: عَلَّمَهُۥ شَدِيدُ ٱلۡقُوَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the angel Gabriel.

data.price: and of great perfection[2], who manifested himself [in his true form][3]
data.arabic: ذُو مِرَّةٖ فَٱسۡتَوَىٰ
data.footnotes:
[2] i.e., the strength of body and mind.
 [3] Archangel Gabriel appeared to the Prophet (ﷺ) only twice in his angelic form: once at the outset of the Prophet’s mission (as he manifested himself, filling the horizon, so the Prophet (ﷺ) lost his consciousness), and another time during the Prophet’s ascension to the seventh heaven where he directly received from Allah the order to pray five times a day. See 17:1.

data.price: when he was on the higher horizon[4].
data.arabic: وَهُوَ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., above the eastern horizon in the sky where the sun rises.

data.price: Then he approached [the Prophet] and descended,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ

data.price: until he was only two bow-lengths away or even closer.
data.arabic: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوۡسَيۡنِ أَوۡ أَدۡنَىٰ

data.price: Then he revealed to His slave[5] what he had to reveal.
data.arabic: فَأَوۡحَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦ مَآ أَوۡحَىٰ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

data.price: The [Prophet’s] heart[6] did not deny what he saw.
data.arabic: مَا كَذَبَ ٱلۡفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., his mind or perception.

data.price: Do you dispute with him concerning what he saw?
data.arabic: أَفَتُمَٰرُونَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ

data.price: He certainly saw him a second time[7]
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ نَزۡلَةً أُخۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., During his ascent (al-Mi‘rāj) to the heavens, he saw Gabriel in his true angelic form.

data.price: at the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary [in the seventh heaven]
data.arabic: عِندَ سِدۡرَةِ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ

data.price: near which is the Garden of Abode,
data.arabic: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰٓ

data.price: when the Lote Tree was overwhelmed with [divine] splendors.
data.arabic: إِذۡ يَغۡشَى ٱلسِّدۡرَةَ مَا يَغۡشَىٰ

data.price: His gaze did not wander, nor did it look beyond the limit.
data.arabic: مَا زَاغَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ

data.price: He certainly saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ رَأَىٰ مِنۡ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰٓ

data.price: Have you [O disbelievers] thought about [the idols of] Lāt and ‘Uzzā,
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱللَّٰتَ وَٱلۡعُزَّىٰ

data.price: and Manāt, the third one as well[8]?
data.arabic: وَمَنَوٰةَ ٱلثَّالِثَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [8] These were three well-known idols or goddesses worshiped by Arab pagans before the advent of Islam.

data.price: Do you choose for yourselves males and for Him females?
data.arabic: أَلَكُمُ ٱلذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: That is then an unfair division!
data.arabic: تِلۡكَ إِذٗا قِسۡمَةٞ ضِيزَىٰٓ

data.price: These [idols] are no more than names you and your forefathers have made up[9], for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and what their souls desire, although there has come to them guidance from their Lord.
data.arabic: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّآ أَسۡمَآءٞ سَمَّيۡتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَٰنٍۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهۡوَى ٱلۡأَنفُسُۖ وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., You have considered them gods while in fact, they are not.

data.price: Is it that man can get whatever he wishes for[10]?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ
data.footnotes: [10] The pagans worshiped these idols wishing that they would intercede for them on the Day of Resurrection. See 39:3.

data.price: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and this world.
data.arabic: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: How many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will be of no avail except after Allah’s permission to whom He wills and pleases.
data.arabic: ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٖ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغۡنِي شَفَٰعَتُهُمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن يَأۡذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرۡضَىٰٓ

data.price: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels female names.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ تَسۡمِيَةَ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: They have no knowledge about it. They only follow conjecture, but conjecture is of no avail against the truth.
data.arabic: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ عِلۡمٍۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَيۡـٔٗا

data.price: So pay no heed to those who turn away from Our message[11] and who only seek the life of this world.
data.arabic: فَأَعۡرِضۡ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَلَمۡ يُرِدۡ إِلَّا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., the Qur’an.

data.price: That is the limit of their knowledge. Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way, and He knows best who is guided.
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبۡلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ

data.price: To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, so that He may recompense the evildoers for what they did, and reward those who do good with the best reward[12],
data.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔواْ بِمَا عَمِلُواْ وَيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَى
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., Paradise.

data.price: those who avoid major sins and shameful acts, except for minor lapses. Indeed, your Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you best, as He created you from the earth[13] and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers[14]. So do not claim purity for yourselves, for He knows best who is truly righteous.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِۚ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِكُمۡ إِذۡ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِذۡ أَنتُمۡ أَجِنَّةٞ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمۡۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓاْ أَنفُسَكُمۡۖ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
data.footnotes:
[13] i.e., created your father, Adam.
 [14] See footnote 31:34.

data.price: Have you seen the one who turned away [from Islam],
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: who gave a little, and then stopped?
data.arabic: وَأَعۡطَىٰ قَلِيلٗا وَأَكۡدَىٰٓ

data.price: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he has insight[15]?
data.arabic: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلۡمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [15] i.e., the knowledge that his wealth will be exhausted if he spends on the poor, while Allah has promised that it nourishes wealth.

data.price: Or has he not been informed of what is in the Scriptures of Moses,
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَمۡ يُنَبَّأۡ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ

data.price: and of Abraham, who fulfilled his duty?
data.arabic: وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِي وَفَّىٰٓ

data.price: That no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another,
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٞ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: and that man will not receive except what he strives for,
data.arabic: وَأَن لَّيۡسَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ

data.price: and that his efforts will be examined,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ سَعۡيَهُۥ سَوۡفَ يُرَىٰ

data.price: then he will be recompensed in full,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُجۡزَىٰهُ ٱلۡجَزَآءَ ٱلۡأَوۡفَىٰ

data.price: and that to your Lord is the final return,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ

data.price: and that He is the One Who makes people laugh and weep[16],
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضۡحَكَ وَأَبۡكَىٰ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., brings happiness or sadness to people.

data.price: and that He is the One Who causes death and gives life,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحۡيَا

data.price: and that He created the pairs, male and female,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: from a drop of sperm when it is emitted,
data.arabic: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ إِذَا تُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: and it is upon Him to bring about the second creation.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: And He is the One Who enriches and bestows wealth,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغۡنَىٰ وَأَقۡنَىٰ

data.price: and that He is the Lord of Sirius[17].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [17] i.e., a star worshiped by some pagans before Islam.

data.price: And that He destroyed the earlier ‘Ād[18],
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهۡلَكَ عَادًا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ
data.footnotes: [18] i.e., the people of Prophet Hūd.

data.price: and Thamūd[19], sparing none,
data.arabic: وَثَمُودَاْ فَمَآ أَبۡقَىٰ
data.footnotes: [19] i.e., the people of Prophet Sālih, who are called second Ād.

data.price: and [He destroyed] the people of Noah before them; they were indeed more wicked and more rebellious.
data.arabic: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ هُمۡ أَظۡلَمَ وَأَطۡغَىٰ

data.price: And He toppled the cities[20] upside down,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَةَ أَهۡوَىٰ
data.footnotes: [20] Of Sodom and Gomorrah whose dwellers defied Prophet Lot (عليه السلام).

data.price: and they were utterly covered [by stones][21].
data.arabic: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
data.footnotes: [21] They were rained by stones.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ

data.price: This [Prophet] is a warner like the earlier warners.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٞ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ

data.price: The imminent Hour has drawn near,
data.arabic: أَزِفَتِ ٱلۡأٓزِفَةُ

data.price: none but Allah can disclose it.
data.arabic: لَيۡسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ

data.price: Do you find this discourse astonishing,
data.arabic: أَفَمِنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ تَعۡجَبُونَ

data.price: and you laugh [at it] and not weep,
data.arabic: وَتَضۡحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبۡكُونَ

data.price: while heedlessly lost in amusement?
data.arabic: وَأَنتُمۡ سَٰمِدُونَ

data.price: So prostrate to Allah and worship [Him].
data.arabic: فَٱسۡجُدُواْۤ لِلَّهِۤ وَٱعۡبُدُواْ۩

data.price: The Hour has drawn near and the moon has split asunder[1].
data.arabic: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ
data.footnotes: [1] The Quraysh pagans challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) to split the moon in two so that they believe in him. The moon was split as they requested and then re-joined, and the incident was reported by several eyewitnesses in different parts of the land; however, they still refused to believe, considering it magic.

data.price: Whenever they see a sign[2], they turn away and say, “Same old magic!”
data.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يُعۡرِضُواْ وَيَقُولُواْ سِحۡرٞ مُّسۡتَمِرّٞ
data.footnotes: [2] The prophets were given signs or miracles as a proof that they were commissioned by Allah. Moses (عليه السلام) was given the miracles of staff and a bright hand. Jesus (عليه السلام) would give life to the dead and heal the blind and the leper. Muhammad (ﷺ) was given the Qur’an, a literary miracle, challenging the masters of Arabic eloquence. Nonetheless, he (ﷺ) performed other miracles such as splitting the moon, increasing food and water, and healing some ailments.

data.price: They deny [the truth] and follow their desires, but every matter will reach its inevitable end.
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓاْ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرٖ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

data.price: There have already come to them stories [of destroyed nations] that are sufficient to deter them,
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ

data.price: which contain extensive wisdom, but the warnings are of no avail.
data.arabic: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَٰلِغَةٞۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ

data.price: So turn away from them [O Prophet]. On the Day when the caller[3] will summon them to a horrific event[4],
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ يَوۡمَ يَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ نُّكُرٍ
data.footnotes: [3] Isrāfīl, the angel assigned to blow the Trumpet and call all for resurrection. [4] i.e., Judgment Day.

data.price: with eyes downcast, they will come out of the graves like scattered locusts,
data.arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادٞ مُّنتَشِرٞ

data.price: rushing headlong towards the caller. The disbelievers will say, “This is a hard Day!”
data.arabic: مُّهۡطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ يَقُولُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَسِرٞ

data.price: The people of Noah rejected [the truth] before them; they rejected Our slave and said, “He is a madman,” and he was intimidated.
data.arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ فَكَذَّبُواْ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُواْ مَجۡنُونٞ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ

data.price: So he called upon his Lord, “I am overpowered, so help me!”
data.arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَغۡلُوبٞ فَٱنتَصِرۡ

data.price: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,
data.arabic: فَفَتَحۡنَآ أَبۡوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٖ مُّنۡهَمِرٖ

data.price: and We caused the earth to burst forth with springs, then the waters met for a preordained purpose.
data.arabic: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُيُونٗا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡرٖ قَدۡ قُدِرَ

data.price: We carried him on an [Ark made] of planks and nails,
data.arabic: وَحَمَلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَٰحٖ وَدُسُرٖ

data.price: sailing under Our [Watchful] Eyes; as a reward for the one [they] denied.
data.arabic: تَجۡرِي بِأَعۡيُنِنَا جَزَآءٗ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ

data.price: We have certainly left it[5] as a sign; is there anyone to take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَٰهَآ ءَايَةٗ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the punishment, the Flood, or the Ark.

data.price: Then how were My punishment and My warnings[6]?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
data.footnotes: [6] As a warning to those who came after them.

data.price: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: ‘Ād disbelieved. Then how were My punishment and My warnings?
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٞ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: We sent against them a furious wind[7] on a day of continuous misfortune,
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., a tumultuous and screaming wind.

data.price: sweeping people away[8], as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.
data.arabic: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٖ مُّنقَعِرٖ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., extracting them from the earth.

data.price: Then how were My punishment and My warnings?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: Thamūd rejected the warnings,
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: They said, “Shall we follow a single human being[9] from among us? Then we would surely be in error and insanity!
data.arabic: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٗا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدٗا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٍ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., Prophet Sālih (عليه السلام).

data.price: Has the revelation been sent down upon him out of all of us? Rather, he is an insolent liar.”
data.arabic: أَءُلۡقِيَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٞ

data.price: Tomorrow they will know who the insolent liar is.
data.arabic: سَيَعۡلَمُونَ غَدٗا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ

data.price: We are sending the she-camel as a test for them, so watch them [O Sālih] and be patient,
data.arabic: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ

data.price: and tell them that the water is to be shared between them[10]; each should take its drink in turn.
data.arabic: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَآءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبٖ مُّحۡتَضَرٞ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., one day for the tribe of Thamūd and one day for the she-camel.

data.price: But they called their companion[11], and he undertook the task[12] and hamstrung her.
data.arabic: فَنَادَوۡاْ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
data.footnotes:
[11] i.e., the worst among them.
 [12] Or took his sword.

data.price: Then how [terrible] My punishment and My warnings were!
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs[13].
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ
data.footnotes: [13] The people of Thamūd were crushed like trampled and trodden twigs and pieces of bush lying around an enclosure for cattle.

data.price: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: We sent against them a storm of pebbles, except the family of Lot whom We saved before dawn,
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٖۖ نَّجَّيۡنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٖ

data.price: as a blessing from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
data.arabic: نِّعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي مَن شَكَرَ

data.price: He had already warned them of Our punishing assault, but they doubted the warnings.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡاْ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: They even demanded that he let them have their way with his angel-guests[14], so We blinded their eyes, [saying], “Taste My punishment and My warnings!”
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَآ أَعۡيُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
data.footnotes: [14] Whom Allah sent in the form of handsome young men.

data.price: By the early morning a lasting torment overtook them.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابٞ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

data.price: Taste My punishment and My warnings!
data.arabic: فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: Indeed, warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ

data.price: But they rejected all of Our signs, so We seized them with the grip of the All-Mighty, Most Powerful.
data.arabic: كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِيزٖ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ

data.price: Are your disbelievers [O Makkans] superior to those[15] or have you been granted immunity in divine Scriptures?
data.arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أُوْلَٰٓئِكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٞ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
data.footnotes: [15] i.e., those destroyed peoples.

data.price: Or do they say, “We are a united front, bound to prevail.”?
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِيعٞ مُّنتَصِرٞ

data.price: Soon their united front will be defeated, and they will flee[16].
data.arabic: سَيُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
data.footnotes: [16] This foretold event was fulfilled in the Battle of Badr.

data.price: But the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour is more catastrophic and more bitter.
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ

data.price: Indeed, the wicked are in error and madness[17].
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٖ
data.footnotes: [17] Or "in the blazes of fire."

data.price: On the Day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, [they will be told], “Taste the agony of Hell[18]!”
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُسۡحَبُونَ فِي ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
data.footnotes: [18] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.

data.price: We have surely created everything in a determined measure[19].
data.arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٖ
data.footnotes: [19] Or perfectly preordained.

data.price: Our command is but a single word[20], which is fulfilled in the blink of an eye.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَمۡرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٞ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ
data.footnotes: [20] Our command when We want something, We only say, "Be," and it is.

data.price: We have destroyed many like you [O Makkans][21]; is there anyone to take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَآ أَشۡيَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
data.footnotes: [21] In rejecting Allah's messengers.

data.price: Everything they did is in the written records,
data.arabic: وَكُلُّ شَيۡءٖ فَعَلُوهُ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ

data.price: and everything, small or big, is written down.
data.arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٖ وَكَبِيرٖ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and rivers[22],
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَهَرٖ
data.footnotes: [22] Rivers of water, honey, milk, and wine. See 47:15.

data.price: seated in honor in the presence of the Most Powerful Sovereign.
data.arabic: فِي مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٖ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ

data.price: The Most Compassionate,
data.arabic: ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ

data.price: has taught the Qur’an,
data.arabic: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ

data.price: He created man,
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ

data.price: and taught him speech.
data.arabic: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلۡبَيَانَ

data.price: The sun and the moon follow their precise courses,
data.arabic: ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ بِحُسۡبَانٖ

data.price: and the stars[1] and trees prostrate [to Allah][2].
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّجۡمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسۡجُدَانِ
data.footnotes:
[1] "Najm" is also a vegetation without a trunk, stalk, or stem.
 [2] i.e., they obediently submit to the laws of Allah. See 22:18.

data.price: He raised the heaven and enjoined justice
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ

data.price: so that you may not transgress the limits of justice.
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَطۡغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡمِيزَانِ

data.price: Therefore establish weights in justice, and do not give short measure.
data.arabic: وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُواْ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ

data.price: He has spread out the earth for all creatures,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلۡأَنَامِ

data.price: in which there are fruits and palm trees with date stalks,
data.arabic: فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَٱلنَّخۡلُ ذَاتُ ٱلۡأَكۡمَامِ

data.price: and grain having chaff, and fragrant plants.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡحَبُّ ذُو ٱلۡعَصۡفِ وَٱلرَّيۡحَانُ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you[3] deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., men and jinn.

data.price: He created man from dry clay like pottery,
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ كَٱلۡفَخَّارِ

data.price: and He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
data.arabic: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٖ مِّن نَّارٖ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets[4].
data.arabic: رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقَيۡنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَغۡرِبَيۡنِ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., the points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west in both summer and winter.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: He merges the two seas meeting together[5],
data.arabic: مَرَجَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَيۡنِ يَلۡتَقِيَانِ
data.footnotes: [5] Two bodies of water or two sea waters of fresh and salty water.

data.price: yet between them is a barrier so that they do not cross[6].
data.arabic: بَيۡنَهُمَا بَرۡزَخٞ لَّا يَبۡغِيَانِ
data.footnotes: [6] See footnote 25:53.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Out of both of them emerge pearls and coral.
data.arabic: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهُمَا ٱللُّؤۡلُؤُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: To Him belong the sailing ships raised up in the sea like mountains.
data.arabic: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَٰمِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Everyone on earth will perish,
data.arabic: كُلُّ مَنۡ عَلَيۡهَا فَانٖ

data.price: but there will remain the Face of your Lord[7], full of Majesty and Honor.
data.arabic: وَيَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., your Lord Himself.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: All those in the heavens and earth ask of Him; every day He is engaged in some matters[8].
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ يَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأۡنٖ
data.footnotes: [8] Such as giving life and causing death, enriching some and impoverishing others, elevating some and debasing others, etc.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: We will attend to you, O two multitudes [of men and jinn].
data.arabic: سَنَفۡرُغُ لَكُمۡ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: O assembly of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the realms of the heavens and earth, then pass; you cannot pass without [Our] authority.
data.arabic: يَٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُواْ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُواْۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: There will be sent against you a flame of fire and smoke[9], and you will not be able to defend yourselves.
data.arabic: يُرۡسَلُ عَلَيۡكُمَا شُوَاظٞ مِّن نَّارٖ وَنُحَاسٞ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
data.footnotes: [9] It could also mean liquefied brass or copper.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: When the heaven is split asunder and becomes crimson like [burnt] oil[10].
data.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةٗ كَٱلدِّهَانِ
data.footnotes: [10] Or like tanned skin or molten brass.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: On that Day no human or jinn will be asked about his sin[11].
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٞ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
data.footnotes: [11] For Allah knows their sins; they will only be interrogated as a form of punishment.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: The wicked will be known by their marks and will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
data.arabic: يُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمۡ فَيُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِي وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: [They will be told] “This is the Hell that the wicked used to deny.”
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: They will go round between it and scalding water.
data.arabic: يَطُوفُونَ بَيۡنَهَا وَبَيۡنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٖ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny[12]?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
data.footnotes: [12] Warning of the punishment in Hell is listed here as a favor as a reminder that the believers should be cautious of it and be saved of it on the Day of Judgment.

data.price: For those who fear of standing before their Lord[13] will be two Gardens.
data.arabic: وَلِمَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
data.footnotes: [13] On the Day of Judgment.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Shaded by spreading branches.
data.arabic: ذَوَاتَآ أَفۡنَانٖ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: In each there are two flowing springs.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ تَجۡرِيَانِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: In each there are two kinds of every fruit.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٖ زَوۡجَانِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: They will recline on couches lined with rich brocade, with the fruits of both gardens within reach.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقٖۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَيۡنِ دَانٖ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: In them there will be maidens of restrained gaze[14], untouched[15] before them by any man or jinn.
data.arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
data.footnotes:
[14] To their own mates, being chaste and modest.
 [15] Lit., the maidens have not been caused to bleed by loss of virginity.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: As if they were rubies and pearls[16].
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلۡيَاقُوتُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ
data.footnotes: [16] In purity and beauty.

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Is the reward for goodness anything but goodness?
data.arabic: هَلۡ جَزَآءُ ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنُ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: And besides these two there will be two other gardens.
data.arabic: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Both of the deepest green.
data.arabic: مُدۡهَآمَّتَانِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: In each there are two gushing springs.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: In each there are fruits, palm trees, and pomegranates.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَنَخۡلٞ وَرُمَّانٞ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: In them there are beautiful noble women.
data.arabic: فِيهِنَّ خَيۡرَٰتٌ حِسَانٞ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Maidens with gorgeous eyes, reserved in pavilions.
data.arabic: حُورٞ مَّقۡصُورَٰتٞ فِي ٱلۡخِيَامِ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: No human or jinn has ever touched them before.
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: [They will be] reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرٖ وَعَبۡقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٖ

data.price: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: Blessed is the Name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Honor.
data.arabic: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

data.price: When the Inevitable Event comes to pass,
data.arabic: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ

data.price: there will be none to deny its occurrence;
data.arabic: لَيۡسَ لِوَقۡعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ

data.price: it will bring some low and raise others up[1].
data.arabic: خَافِضَةٞ رَّافِعَةٌ
data.footnotes: [1] According to their deeds rather than wealth and social position, as is the case in this world. The righteous will be elevated in Paradise and the wicked will be debased in Hell.

data.price: When the earth is shaken violently,
data.arabic: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ رَجّٗا

data.price: and the mountains crushed to pieces,
data.arabic: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ بَسّٗا

data.price: and turn to scattered dust,
data.arabic: فَكَانَتۡ هَبَآءٗ مُّنۢبَثّٗا

data.price: then you are sorted into three groups:
data.arabic: وَكُنتُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا ثَلَٰثَةٗ

data.price: the people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right[2]!
data.arabic: فَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., those who receive their record of deeds in the right hand and are destined for Paradise.

data.price: The people of the left – how miserable will be the people of the left[3]!
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., those who receive their record of deeds in the left hand and are destined for Hell.

data.price: And the forerunners [in faith] are the forerunners [in Paradise].
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ

data.price: They are the nearest ones [to Allah],
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: in Gardens of Bliss,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: many from the early generations,
data.arabic: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: and a few from the later generations.
data.arabic: وَقَلِيلٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: [They will be seated] on jeweled couches,
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّوۡضُونَةٖ

data.price: reclining on them, facing one another.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَيۡهَا مُتَقَٰبِلِينَ

data.price: They will be served by immortal youths
data.arabic: يَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ

data.price: with cups, pitchers, and glasses [of wine] from a flowing spring,
data.arabic: بِأَكۡوَابٖ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأۡسٖ مِّن مَّعِينٖ

data.price: which will neither cause any headache nor intoxication,
data.arabic: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنۡهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ

data.price: along with fruits of their choice,
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ

data.price: and flesh of birds that they may desire.
data.arabic: وَلَحۡمِ طَيۡرٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: And [they will have] maidens with wide gorgeous eyes,
data.arabic: وَحُورٌ عِينٞ

data.price: like pristine pearls,
data.arabic: كَأَمۡثَٰلِ ٱللُّؤۡلُوِٕ ٱلۡمَكۡنُونِ

data.price: as a reward for what they used to do.
data.arabic: جَزَآءَۢ بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: They will not hear therein any idle talk or sinful speech,
data.arabic: لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمًا

data.price: except the words of peace, peace[4].
data.arabic: إِلَّا قِيلٗا سَلَٰمٗا سَلَٰمٗا
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., only exchanging greetings of peace.

data.price: The people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right!
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: [They will be] in the midst of thornless lote trees,
data.arabic: فِي سِدۡرٖ مَّخۡضُودٖ

data.price: and clusters of bananas,
data.arabic: وَطَلۡحٖ مَّنضُودٖ

data.price: and extended shade,
data.arabic: وَظِلّٖ مَّمۡدُودٖ

data.price: and flowing water,
data.arabic: وَمَآءٖ مَّسۡكُوبٖ

data.price: and abundant fruit –
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ كَثِيرَةٖ

data.price: neither ceasing nor restricted –
data.arabic: لَّا مَقۡطُوعَةٖ وَلَا مَمۡنُوعَةٖ

data.price: and elevated mattresses [on beds].
data.arabic: وَفُرُشٖ مَّرۡفُوعَةٍ

data.price: Indeed, We have perfectly created them [i.e., their spouses],
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنشَأۡنَٰهُنَّ إِنشَآءٗ

data.price: and have made them virgins,
data.arabic: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُنَّ أَبۡكَارًا

data.price: loving and of equal age,
data.arabic: عُرُبًا أَتۡرَابٗا

data.price: for the people of the right,
data.arabic: لِّأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: many from the earlier generations,
data.arabic: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: and many from the later generations.
data.arabic: وَثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: And the people of the left – how wretched will be the people of the left!
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ

data.price: [They will be] in scorching wind and scalding water,
data.arabic: فِي سَمُومٖ وَحَمِيمٖ

data.price: in the shade of black smoke,
data.arabic: وَظِلّٖ مِّن يَحۡمُومٖ

data.price: neither cool nor refreshing.
data.arabic: لَّا بَارِدٖ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ

data.price: Indeed, they used to be in luxuries before,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتۡرَفِينَ

data.price: and persisted in the gravest sin[5].
data.arabic: وَكَانُواْ يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلۡحِنثِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., Shirk (associating partners with Allah) or disbelief.

data.price: They used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, will we really be raised again?
data.arabic: وَكَانُواْ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: And our forefathers as well?”
data.arabic: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ

data.price: Say, [O Prophet], “Indeed, the former and later generations
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ وَٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: will be gathered on a predetermined Day.
data.arabic: لَمَجۡمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَٰتِ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ

data.price: Then you, O misguided deniers,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: will surely eat from the tree of zaqqūm[6],
data.arabic: لَأٓكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٖ مِّن زَقُّومٖ
data.footnotes: [6] See footnote 44:43-46.

data.price: filling your bellies with it,
data.arabic: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ

data.price: and drinking scalding water on top of it,
data.arabic: فَشَٰرِبُونَ عَلَيۡهِ مِنَ ٱلۡحَمِيمِ

data.price: drinking like thirsty camels do.”
data.arabic: فَشَٰرِبُونَ شُرۡبَ ٱلۡهِيمِ

data.price: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: It is We Who created you; why do you not then believe [in resurrection]?
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ فَلَوۡلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ

data.price: Have you thought about the semen that you emit?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تُمۡنُونَ

data.price: Is it you who create it, or is it We Who are the Creators?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَخۡلُقُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ

data.price: We have ordained death among you, and nothing can overcome us
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ قَدَّرۡنَا بَيۡنَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

data.price: from transforming you and recreating you in forms that you do not know[7].
data.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمۡثَٰلَكُمۡ وَنُنشِئَكُمۡ فِي مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [7] Or "from replacing you by others like yourselves [in this life] and creating you [in the Hereafter] in that which you do not know."

data.price: You are well aware of the first creation; why do you not then take heed?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُمُ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ فَلَوۡلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: Have you thought about what you sow?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تَحۡرُثُونَ

data.price: Is it you who cause it to grow, or is it We Who make it grow?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَزۡرَعُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلزَّٰرِعُونَ

data.price: If We willed, We could reduce your harvest to rubble, leaving you to wonder and lament,
data.arabic: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ حُطَٰمٗا فَظَلۡتُمۡ تَفَكَّهُونَ

data.price: “We suffered loss,
data.arabic: إِنَّا لَمُغۡرَمُونَ

data.price: rather, we are deprived.”
data.arabic: بَلۡ نَحۡنُ مَحۡرُومُونَ

data.price: Have you thought about the water that you drink?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَآءَ ٱلَّذِي تَشۡرَبُونَ

data.price: Is it you who bring it down from the clouds, or is it We Who bring it down?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنزَلۡتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُزۡنِ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنزِلُونَ

data.price: If We willed, We could make it salty; will you not then give thanks?
data.arabic: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ جَعَلۡنَٰهُ أُجَاجٗا فَلَوۡلَا تَشۡكُرُونَ

data.price: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِي تُورُونَ

data.price: Is it you who produced its trees[8], or is it We Who produced it?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنشَأۡتُمۡ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنشِـُٔونَ
data.footnotes: [8] Referring to Arabian trees, markh and ‘afār, which produce fire when their green branches are rubbed against each other.

data.price: We made it a reminder [of the Hellfire] and a benefit for the travelers[9].
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ جَعَلۡنَٰهَا تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَمَتَٰعٗا لِّلۡمُقۡوِينَ
data.footnotes: [9] By which they ignite fire. Travelers are mentioned in particular because it is of special convenience to them, although it is of use for all people in general.

data.price: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: I do swear[10] by the positions of the stars –
data.arabic: ۞ فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَوَٰقِعِ ٱلنُّجُومِ
data.footnotes: [10] The negative article "la" (nay) means: The truth is not what is said or thought by disbelievers or others. The oath refutes certain objections of the disbelievers with regard to the Qur’an.

data.price: and this is indeed a great oath, if only you knew –
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَقَسَمٞ لَّوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ

data.price: that this is indeed a noble Qur’an,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقُرۡءَانٞ كَرِيمٞ

data.price: in a well-preserved Record[11],
data.arabic: فِي كِتَٰبٖ مَّكۡنُونٖ
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., the Preserved Tablet.

data.price: that none can touch except the purified ones[12] –
data.arabic: لَّا يَمَسُّهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلۡمُطَهَّرُونَ
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., angels. It refutes the claim of the pagans that the Qur’an was sent down by devils. (See 26:210-212). Based on this verse, many Muslim jurists held that one should perform ablution prior to reading the Qur’an.

data.price: a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: تَنزِيلٞ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Do you take this discourse lightly,
data.arabic: أَفَبِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ أَنتُم مُّدۡهِنُونَ

data.price: and instead [of thanking Allah] for the provision you are given, you show ingratitude?
data.arabic: وَتَجۡعَلُونَ رِزۡقَكُمۡ أَنَّكُمۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: Then why [are you helpless] when the soul reaches the throat,
data.arabic: فَلَوۡلَآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلۡحُلۡقُومَ

data.price: while you are looking on,
data.arabic: وَأَنتُمۡ حِينَئِذٖ تَنظُرُونَ

data.price: when We are closer[13] to him than you, but you do not see?
data.arabic: وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَيۡهِ مِنكُمۡ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُبۡصِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [13] We are closer to him in terms of Knowledge and Power; Our angels are closer in person.

data.price: If you are not subject to retribution, then why do you not
data.arabic: فَلَوۡلَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ غَيۡرَ مَدِينِينَ

data.price: bring that [soul] back, if you are truthful?
data.arabic: تَرۡجِعُونَهَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: If that dying person is one of those who will be brought near to Allah,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ

data.price: then [he will have] comfort, fragrance[14], and a Garden of Bliss.
data.arabic: فَرَوۡحٞ وَرَيۡحَانٞ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [14] lit., fragrant basil. Paradise is described in the Qur’an as being pleasant to the eye, the heart, and the ear. Here it also emphasizes the scent.

data.price: If he is one of the people of the right,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: [He will be told], “Peace be to you, for being one of the people of the right.”
data.arabic: فَسَلَٰمٞ لَّكَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: But if he is one of the misguided deniers,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: then he will be welcomed with scalding water,
data.arabic: فَنُزُلٞ مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ

data.price: and he will burn in Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: وَتَصۡلِيَةُ جَحِيمٍ

data.price: This is indeed the absolute truth.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ ٱلۡيَقِينِ

data.price: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: All that is in the heavens and earth glorifies[1] Allah, for He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
data.arabic: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
data.footnotes: [1] By praising and exalting Him far above any deficiency or imperfection.

data.price: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth; He gives life and causes death, and He is Most Capable of all things.
data.arabic: لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ يُحۡيِۦ وَيُمِيتُۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ

data.price: He is the First[2] and the Last[3], the Manifest[4] and the Hidden[5], and He is All-Knowing of everything.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلۡأَوَّلُ وَٱلۡأٓخِرُ وَٱلظَّٰهِرُ وَٱلۡبَاطِنُۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٌ
data.footnotes: [2] Before Whom nothing existed; the foremost; the uppermost. [3] Eternal after Whom nothing remains. [4] High, nothing is above Him. [5] Nothing is nearer than Him by way of His knowledge; concealed from our physical senses.

data.price: It is He Who created the heavens and earth in six days, and then rose over the Throne. He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out of it, and all that descends from the heaven and all that ascends to it. He is with you[6] wherever you are, and Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ ثُمَّ ٱسۡتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡعَرۡشِۖ يَعۡلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهَا وَمَا يَنزِلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا يَعۡرُجُ فِيهَاۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ بَصِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [6] By His Knowledge - observing and witnessing all.

data.price: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and to Allah will return all matters.
data.arabic: لَّهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرۡجَعُ ٱلۡأُمُورُ

data.price: He causes the night to merge into the day and the day to merge into the night, and He is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.
data.arabic: يُولِجُ ٱلَّيۡلَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِي ٱلَّيۡلِۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ

data.price: Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend [in Allah’s cause] out of what He has entrusted you with. For those among you who believe and spend[7], there will be a great reward.
data.arabic: ءَامِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَأَنفِقُواْ مِمَّا جَعَلَكُم مُّسۡتَخۡلَفِينَ فِيهِۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنكُمۡ وَأَنفَقُواْ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٞ كَبِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [7] In the way of Allah.

data.price: Why is it that you do not believe in Allah when the Messenger is calling you to believe in your Lord, and He has already taken a covenant from you[8], if you will ever believe?
data.arabic: وَمَا لَكُمۡ لَا تُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلرَّسُولُ يَدۡعُوكُمۡ لِتُؤۡمِنُواْ بِرَبِّكُمۡ وَقَدۡ أَخَذَ مِيثَٰقَكُمۡ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: It is He Who sends down clear verses to His slave to bring you out of the depths of darkness into the light. Indeed, Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to you.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦٓ ءَايَٰتِۭ بَيِّنَٰتٖ لِّيُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُمۡ لَرَءُوفٞ رَّحِيمٞ

data.price: Why is it that you do not spend in the cause of Allah, when Allah alone will inherit the heavens and earth? Those of you who spent and fought before the conquest [of Makkah and those who did not] are not equal. They are much greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterward[9]. Yet Allah has promised each a fine reward, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
data.arabic: وَمَا لَكُمۡ أَلَّا تُنفِقُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَٰثُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ لَا يَسۡتَوِي مِنكُم مَّنۡ أَنفَقَ مِن قَبۡلِ ٱلۡفَتۡحِ وَقَٰتَلَۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَعۡظَمُ دَرَجَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنفَقُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدُ وَقَٰتَلُواْۚ وَكُلّٗا وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [9] Muslims were perceived as weak before the conquest of Makkah. Therefore, those believers who donated and fought in times of weakness and hardship deserve more rewards than those who did so when Muslims were victors and had an upper hand against the enemies.

data.price: Who is there to lend Allah a goodly loan, so He will multiply it for him, and for him there will be a generous reward[10]?
data.arabic: مَّن ذَا ٱلَّذِي يُقۡرِضُ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا فَيُضَٰعِفَهُۥ لَهُۥ وَلَهُۥٓ أَجۡرٞ كَرِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., Paradise.

data.price: [Remember] the Day when you will see the believing men and women, with their light streaming ahead of them and on their right. [They will be told], “Glad tidings for you Today: gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever.” That is the supreme triumph.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرَى ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ يَسۡعَىٰ نُورُهُم بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَبِأَيۡمَٰنِهِمۖ بُشۡرَىٰكُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَاۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ

data.price: On that Day the hypocrite men and women will say to those who believe, “Wait for us, so that we may have some of your light.” It will be said, “Go back and seek light elsewhere[11].” Then a wall will be placed between them, which will have a gate[12], on the inside of which there will be mercy and on the outside there will be punishment.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُولُ ٱلۡمُنَٰفِقُونَ وَٱلۡمُنَٰفِقَٰتُ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱنظُرُونَا نَقۡتَبِسۡ مِن نُّورِكُمۡ قِيلَ ٱرۡجِعُواْ وَرَآءَكُمۡ فَٱلۡتَمِسُواْ نُورٗاۖ فَضُرِبَ بَيۡنَهُم بِسُورٖ لَّهُۥ بَابُۢ بَاطِنُهُۥ فِيهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَةُ وَظَٰهِرُهُۥ مِن قِبَلِهِ ٱلۡعَذَابُ
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., the worldly life from where the light was acquired. [12] This wall is said to be the barrier between Paradise and Hell, which is called Al-A‘rāf (the heights). See 7:46-49.

data.price: The hypocrites will call out to the believers, “Were we not with you?” They will say, “Yes, but you allowed yourselves[13] to succumb to temptations, you awaited [some misfortune to befall us], you doubted, and you were deceived by false hopes, until Allah’s decree came to pass. Thus the deceiver [i.e., Satan] deceived you concerning Allah.
data.arabic: يُنَادُونَهُمۡ أَلَمۡ نَكُن مَّعَكُمۡۖ قَالُواْ بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمۡ فَتَنتُمۡ أَنفُسَكُمۡ وَتَرَبَّصۡتُمۡ وَٱرۡتَبۡتُمۡ وَغَرَّتۡكُمُ ٱلۡأَمَانِيُّ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَ أَمۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡغَرُورُ
data.footnotes: [13] By hypocrisy.

data.price: So this Day no ransom will be accepted from you or from the disbelievers. Your abode is the Fire; it is a fitting place for you – what a wretched destination!”
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ لَا يُؤۡخَذُ مِنكُمۡ فِدۡيَةٞ وَلَا مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۚ مَأۡوَىٰكُمُ ٱلنَّارُۖ هِيَ مَوۡلَىٰكُمۡۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

data.price: Has the time not yet come for those who believe that their hearts should be humbled at the remembrance of Allah and the truth that has been revealed? And that they should not be like those who were given the Scripture before, whose hearts grew hard after the passage of a long time, and many of them were evildoers.
data.arabic: ۞ أَلَمۡ يَأۡنِ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَن تَخۡشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمۡ لِذِكۡرِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا نَزَلَ مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا يَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبۡلُ فَطَالَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡأَمَدُ فَقَسَتۡ قُلُوبُهُمۡۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ

data.price: Know that Allah revives the earth after its death[14]. We have made the signs clear to you so that you may understand.
data.arabic: ٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحۡيِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ مَوۡتِهَاۚ قَدۡ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] Similarly, it is easy for Allah to soften the hearts and guide after misguidance.

data.price: Indeed, those men and women who give in charity and lend to Allah a goodly loan, it will be multiplied for them, and for them there will be a generous reward[15].
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُصَّدِّقِينَ وَٱلۡمُصَّدِّقَٰتِ وَأَقۡرَضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا يُضَٰعَفُ لَهُمۡ وَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٞ كَرِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [15] i.e., Paradise.

data.price: Those who believe in Allah and His messengers, it is they who are the people of the truth. And the martyrs will have their reward and their light with their Lord. As for those who disbelieve and reject Our verses, they are the people of the Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦٓ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصِّدِّيقُونَۖ وَٱلشُّهَدَآءُ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرُهُمۡ وَنُورُهُمۡۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: Know that the life of this world is no more than play, amusement, adornment, boasting among yourselves, and competition in wealth and children. It is like plants that flourish after rain, pleasing the sowers, then they wither and you see them turning yellow, and then they crumble. And in the Hereafter there will be severe punishment, or forgiveness from Allah and His pleasure. For the life of this world is no more than a fleeting enjoyment.
data.arabic: ٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَا لَعِبٞ وَلَهۡوٞ وَزِينَةٞ وَتَفَاخُرُۢ بَيۡنَكُمۡ وَتَكَاثُرٞ فِي ٱلۡأَمۡوَٰلِ وَٱلۡأَوۡلَٰدِۖ كَمَثَلِ غَيۡثٍ أَعۡجَبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارَ نَبَاتُهُۥ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَىٰهُ مُصۡفَرّٗا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَٰمٗاۖ وَفِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدٞ وَمَغۡفِرَةٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضۡوَٰنٞۚ وَمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَآ إِلَّا مَتَٰعُ ٱلۡغُرُورِ

data.price: Race one another towards forgiveness from your Lord and Paradise the width of which is like the width of the heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, for Allah is the Lord of great bounty.
data.arabic: سَابِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَغۡفِرَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرۡضُهَا كَعَرۡضِ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ أُعِدَّتۡ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضۡلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤۡتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلۡفَضۡلِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: No calamity befalls the earth or yourselves but it is already written in a Record[16] before We bring it into existence. That is indeed easy for Allah –
data.arabic: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٖ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا فِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡ إِلَّا فِي كِتَٰبٖ مِّن قَبۡلِ أَن نَّبۡرَأَهَآۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., the Preserved Tablet.

data.price: so that you may not grieve over what you have missed, nor exult over what He has given you, for Allah does not love anyone who is conceited and boastful –
data.arabic: لِّكَيۡلَا تَأۡسَوۡاْ عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَفۡرَحُواْ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمۡۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخۡتَالٖ فَخُورٍ

data.price: those who are stingy and promote stinginess among people. And those who turn away[17], then Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَبۡخَلُونَ وَيَأۡمُرُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ بِٱلۡبُخۡلِۗ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلۡغَنِيُّ ٱلۡحَمِيدُ
data.footnotes: [17] Refuse to spend in the way of Allah or refuse obedience to Him.

data.price: We have sent Our messengers with clear proofs, and sent down with them the Scripture and the criteria of justice, so that the people may uphold justice. And We sent down iron, in which there is great might and benefits for people, so that Allah may make known those who help His cause and His messengers without seeing Him. Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا رُسُلَنَا بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَأَنزَلۡنَا مَعَهُمُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمِيزَانَ لِيَقُومَ ٱلنَّاسُ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِۖ وَأَنزَلۡنَا ٱلۡحَدِيدَ فِيهِ بَأۡسٞ شَدِيدٞ وَمَنَٰفِعُ لِلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعۡلَمَ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُۥ وَرُسُلَهُۥ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٞ

data.price: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood and Scripture to their offspring: some among them are guided, but most of them are evildoers.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحٗا وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَجَعَلۡنَا فِي ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا ٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَٱلۡكِتَٰبَۖ فَمِنۡهُم مُّهۡتَدٖۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ

data.price: Then We sent Our messengers in their footsteps, and We sent after them Jesus, son of Mary; We gave him the Gospel and instilled kindness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. As for monasticism, they invented it – We did not prescribe it for them – seeking thereby Allah’s pleasure, yet they did not observe it faithfully. So We gave those who believed among them their reward, but most of them are evildoers.
