data.arabic: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ أَيۡمَٰنٌ عَلَيۡنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمۡ لَمَا تَحۡكُمُونَ

data.price: Ask them which of them can guarantee that.
data.arabic: سَلۡهُمۡ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ

data.price: Or do they have associate-gods? Then let them bring forth their associate-gods[8], if they are truthful.
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ شُرَكَآءُ فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمۡ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [8] whom they took as partners with Allah.

data.price: On the Day when the Shin [of Allah] will be uncovered[9], and they are invited to prostrate, but they will not be able to do so.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُكۡشَفُ عَن سَاقٖ وَيُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., It is a Day that everyone will find before him great difficulty. According to a long and authentic Hadīth of Abu Sa‘īd al-Khudrī, "the Shin" refers to that of Allah Almighty, before which every believer will prostrate on the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and hypocrites will not be able to prostrate. The text of the Hadith is as follows: "... Then the Lord will uncover His Shank, so they will prostrate to Him...".

data.price: Their eyes will be downcast, overwhelmed with humiliation, for they were invited to prostrate when they were capable[10] [but they refused].
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۖ وَقَدۡ كَانُواْ يُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمۡ سَٰلِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [10] During the life of this world.

data.price: So leave to Me those who reject this message [O Prophet]. We will gradually lead them to their ruin in ways that they do not perceive[11].
data.arabic: فَذَرۡنِي وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِۖ سَنَسۡتَدۡرِجُهُم مِّنۡ حَيۡثُ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [11] Allah will increase favors upon them in this life as a trial, so they will increase sin, which will lead to their destruction.

data.price: I will give them respite, but My plan is firm.
data.arabic: وَأُمۡلِي لَهُمۡۚ إِنَّ كَيۡدِي مَتِينٌ

data.price: Or are you asking them for a reward, so they find it too burdensome?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ

data.price: Or do they have knowledge of the unseen, so they write it down?
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبُ فَهُمۡ يَكۡتُبُونَ

data.price: So be patient with the decree of your Lord, and do not be like the man of the Whale [i.e., Jonah], when he cried out in anguish[12].
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلۡحُوتِ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكۡظُومٞ
data.footnotes: [12] While inside the belly of the whale. See 21:87 and 37:139-148.

data.price: Had it not been for the grace that he received from his Lord, he would have surely been thrown onto the barren shore, blameworthy[13].
data.arabic: لَّوۡلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعۡمَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلۡعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذۡمُومٞ
data.footnotes: [13] Instead, Allah accepted his repentance and provided for him means of recovery. See 37:139-148.

data.price: But his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.
data.arabic: فَٱجۡتَبَٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: The disbelievers would almost strike you down with their malicious gazes when they hear the Reminder, and they say, “He is certainly mad.”
data.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَيُزۡلِقُونَكَ بِأَبۡصَٰرِهِمۡ لَمَّا سَمِعُواْ ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجۡنُونٞ

data.price: But it is nothing other than a reminder to the whole world.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: The Inevitable Hour!
data.arabic: ٱلۡحَآقَّةُ

data.price: What is the Inevitable Hour?
data.arabic: مَا ٱلۡحَآقَّةُ

data.price: How do you know what the Inevitable Hour is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحَآقَّةُ

data.price: Thamūd and ‘Ād denied the Striking Calamity of the Hour[1].
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ وَعَادُۢ بِٱلۡقَارِعَةِ
data.footnotes: [1] The Striking Calamity is one of the names of the Day of Judgment.

data.price: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by a dreadful blast.
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ

data.price: And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a furious windstorm[2]
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ
data.footnotes: [2] Or by a cold windstorm.

data.price: which He unleashed against them for seven successive nights and eight days, so you would see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
data.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ

data.price: Do you see any trace of them now?
data.arabic: فَهَلۡ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٖ

data.price: Also, Pharaoh and those who came before him, and the overturned cities [of Lot] committed the grave sin,
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ

data.price: each disobeying the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment.
data.arabic: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً

data.price: Indeed, when the floodwater overflowed, We carried you [O humans] in the sailing Ark[3],
data.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [3] Which was made by Noah with Allah's command.

data.price: so that We might make it a reminder for you, and that attentive ears may take heed.
data.arabic: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ

data.price: Then when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ

data.price: and the earth and mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,
data.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ

data.price: on that Day the Inevitable Event will occur.
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ

data.price: And the sky will split asunder and will be frail[4] on that day,
data.arabic: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِيَ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَاهِيَةٞ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., weak and unstable.

data.price: with the angels on all its sides, and on that Day, eight [mighty angels] will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ

data.price: On that day, you will be brought forth [before Allah], and none of your secrets will remain hidden.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ

data.price: As for the one who is given his Record in his right hand, he will say, “Here is my Record, read it!
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ

data.price: I was sure that I would meet my reckoning.”
data.arabic: إِنِّي ظَنَنتُ أَنِّي مُلَٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهۡ

data.price: So he will be in a pleasant life,
data.arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٖ رَّاضِيَةٖ

data.price: in a lofty garden,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٖ

data.price: with clustered fruit within his reach.
data.arabic: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٞ

data.price: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did[5] in the days gone by.”
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [5] Lit., "advanced" anticipating the reward in the Hereafter.

data.price: As for the one who is given his Record in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I had not been given my Record,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ

data.price: nor had I known anything of my reckoning!
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ أَدۡرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهۡ

data.price: Would that it [i.e., death] had been the end of me[6]!
data.arabic: يَٰلَيۡتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلۡقَاضِيَةَ
data.footnotes: [6] Rather than a gateway to eternal life.

data.price: My wealth has been of no avail to me.
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنِّي مَالِيَهۡۜ

data.price: My authority has vanished[7].”
data.arabic: هَلَكَ عَنِّي سُلۡطَٰنِيَهۡ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., I have no valid argument or authority today.

data.price: [It will be said,] “Seize him and shackle him,
data.arabic: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ

data.price: then make him burn in the Blazing Fire,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ

data.price: then tie him up with a chain of seventy cubits long.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ

data.price: For he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: nor did he encourage feeding the needy.
data.arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ

data.price: So Today he will have no close friend here,
data.arabic: فَلَيۡسَ لَهُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ هَٰهُنَا حَمِيمٞ

data.price: nor any food except the discharge of wounds,
data.arabic: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنۡ غِسۡلِينٖ

data.price: none will eat it except the sinners.”
data.arabic: لَّا يَأۡكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلۡخَٰطِـُٔونَ

data.price: I swear by what you can see.
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: and what you cannot see!
data.arabic: وَمَا لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: Indeed, this is the word of a noble Messenger[8],
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولٖ كَرِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., recited by Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

data.price: and it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe!
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little do you take heed!
data.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: تَنزِيلٞ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: If he had falsely attributed something to Us,
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيۡنَا بَعۡضَ ٱلۡأَقَاوِيلِ

data.price: We would have surely seized him by the right hand[9],
data.arabic: لَأَخَذۡنَا مِنۡهُ بِٱلۡيَمِينِ
data.footnotes: [9] Or "by [Our] Right Hand," i.e., Allah would have surely exacted revenge with might and power.

data.price: then severed his aorta[10],
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعۡنَا مِنۡهُ ٱلۡوَتِينَ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., his life artery of the heart; causing immediate death.

data.price: and none of you could have rescued him.
data.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ

data.price: This [Qur’an] is indeed a reminder for those who are righteous.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذۡكِرَةٞ لِّلۡمُتَّقِينَ

data.price: And We surely know that some of you will be deniers,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَعۡلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: and it[11] will certainly be a source of regret for the disbelievers.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسۡرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., denying this Qur’an.

data.price: And this[12] is indeed the absolute truth.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., this Qur’an.

data.price: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: A challenger asked for a punishment bound to come[1]
data.arabic: سَأَلَ سَآئِلُۢ بِعَذَابٖ وَاقِعٖ
data.footnotes: [1] In the Hereafter. The pagans of Makkah had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) in ridicule by asking Allah to bring upon them His punishment. See 8:32.

data.price: upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,
data.arabic: لِّلۡكَٰفِرِينَ لَيۡسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٞ

data.price: from Allah, Lord of the pathways of ascent,
data.arabic: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِي ٱلۡمَعَارِجِ

data.price: by which the angels and the Spirit[2] will ascend to Him on a Day[3] the length of which is fifty thousand years.
data.arabic: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ
data.footnotes:
[2] i.e., the angel Gabriel.
 [3] The Day of Judgment will be an extremely long day.

data.price: So be patient [O Prophet] with beautiful patience.
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ صَبۡرٗا جَمِيلًا

data.price: Indeed, they see this [punishment] far off,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ يَرَوۡنَهُۥ بَعِيدٗا

data.price: but We see it to be close at hand.
data.arabic: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبٗا

data.price: On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass[4]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلۡمُهۡلِ
data.footnotes: [4] Or "murky oil."

data.price: and the mountains will be like dyed wool[5],
data.arabic: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ
data.footnotes: [5] While disintegrating.

data.price: and no close friend will ask about another,
data.arabic: وَلَا يَسۡـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمٗا

data.price: even though they will see one another. The wicked will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by offering his children,
data.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ

data.price: and his wife and his brother,
data.arabic: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِيهِ

data.price: and his kindred who stood by him,
data.arabic: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِي تُـٔۡوِيهِ

data.price: and everyone on earth, just to save himself.
data.arabic: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ

data.price: By no means![6] It is a raging Flame,
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
data.footnotes: [6] An emphatic denial, meaning "It will never be."

data.price: that will strip off the scalps[7].
data.arabic: نَزَّاعَةٗ لِّلشَّوَىٰ
data.footnotes: [7] Referring to the skin of the head or of the body extremities, which will be burned away by severe heat and flames.

data.price: It will call everyone who turned their backs and disobeyed,
data.arabic: تَدۡعُواْ مَنۡ أَدۡبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: and amassed and hoarded wealth.
data.arabic: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوۡعَىٰٓ

data.price: Indeed, man was created impatient:
data.arabic: ۞ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا

data.price: when evil befalls him, he bewails,
data.arabic: إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعٗا

data.price: but when good fortune comes his way, he becomes tight-fisted –
data.arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلۡخَيۡرُ مَنُوعًا

data.price: except those who pray,
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلۡمُصَلِّينَ

data.price: who are steadfast in their prayers;
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمۡ دَآئِمُونَ

data.price: and who give a due share[8] of their wealth
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ فِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., obligatory charity; zakah.

data.price: to the beggar and the dispossessed;
data.arabic: لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ

data.price: and who firmly believe in the Day of Judgment;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: and those who fear the punishment of their Lord –
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ

data.price: for none can feel secure from their Lord’s punishment –
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمۡ غَيۡرُ مَأۡمُونٖ

data.price: and those who guard their private parts[9],
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِفُرُوجِهِمۡ حَٰفِظُونَ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., their chastity and honor from immoralities.

data.price: except from their wives or bondwomen[10] whom they own, for then they are not to be blamed.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., female slaves or slave-girls.

data.price: But whoever seeks beyond that, it is they who are the transgressors.
data.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ

data.price: and those who fulfill their trusts and pledges;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِأَمَٰنَٰتِهِمۡ وَعَهۡدِهِمۡ رَٰعُونَ

data.price: and who are upright in their testimonies;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَٰدَٰتِهِمۡ قَآئِمُونَ

data.price: and who take due care of their prayers;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمۡ يُحَافِظُونَ

data.price: they will be honored in gardens[11].
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ مُّكۡرَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [11] Of Paradise.

data.price: What is the matter with the disbelievers that they are rushing towards you [O Prophet][12],
data.arabic: فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ قِبَلَكَ مُهۡطِعِينَ
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., rushing to deny you.

data.price: from the right and from the left, in crowds[13]?
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
data.footnotes: [13] Some pagans of Makkah gathered around the Prophet (ﷺ) mocking and opposing him, claiming that if there is in fact a Hereafter, they would enter Paradise before the believers.

data.price: Does everyone of them aspire to enter a garden of bliss?
data.arabic: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ

data.price: By no means! We have created them from what they know[14].
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّمَّا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] i.e., from a disdained fluid.

data.price: I swear by the Lord of the sunrises and sunsets[15] that We are surely Capable
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [15] i.e., Allah is the One Who determines the daily points of sunrise and sunset according to each season by the rotation of the earth around its axis.

data.price: to replace them with others better than them, and none can escape Our decree.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

data.price: So leave them to engage in their falsehood and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised;
data.arabic: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: the Day when they will rush out of their graves as if they are racing towards an idol[16],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., just as they used to race towards a newly appointed idol, to be among the first of its worshipers.

data.price: with their eyes downcast and overwhelmed with disgrace. That is the Day that they were promised.
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, “Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.”
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَنۡ أَنذِرۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَأۡتِيَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ

data.price: He said: “O my people, indeed I am a clear warner to you,
data.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ إِنِّي لَكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ

data.price: that you worship Allah and fear Him, and obey me;
data.arabic: أَنِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: He will forgive you some of your sins and grant you respite until an appointed term[1]. Indeed, when Allah’s appointed term comes, it cannot be delayed, if you only knew!”
data.arabic: يَغۡفِرۡ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَيُؤَخِّرۡكُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُۚ لَوۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., until the time your life comes to an end.

data.price: He said, “My Lord, I have surely called my people night and day,
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِي لَيۡلٗا وَنَهَارٗا

data.price: but my call only drove them further away.
data.arabic: فَلَمۡ يَزِدۡهُمۡ دُعَآءِيٓ إِلَّا فِرَارٗا

data.price: Every time I call them so that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and cover their faces with their garments[2], and persist in obstinacy and grow extremely arrogant.
data.arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوٓاْ أَصَٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡاْ ثِيَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّواْ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا
data.footnotes: [2] Refusing to see me or listen to my call.

data.price: Then I called them openly,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ جِهَارٗا

data.price: then I addressed them in public and in private,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَنتُ لَهُمۡ وَأَسۡرَرۡتُ لَهُمۡ إِسۡرَارٗا

data.price: I said, ‘Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving.
data.arabic: فَقُلۡتُ ٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ رَبَّكُمۡ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارٗا

data.price: He will shower you with abundant rain from the sky,
data.arabic: يُرۡسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّدۡرَارٗا

data.price: and He will give you wealth and children, and bestow upon you gardens and rivers.
data.arabic: وَيُمۡدِدۡكُم بِأَمۡوَٰلٖ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ أَنۡهَٰرٗا

data.price: What is the matter with you that you do not fear the Majesty of Allah[3],
data.arabic: مَّا لَكُمۡ لَا تَرۡجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارٗا
data.footnotes: [3] While disobeying Him carelessly.

data.price: when He has created you in stages[4]?
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ خَلَقَكُمۡ أَطۡوَارًا
data.footnotes: [4] See 22:5 and 23:12-14 for the stages of the embryo.

data.price: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one above another,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَوۡاْ كَيۡفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗا

data.price: and has placed the moon therein as a light and the sun as a burning lamp?
data.arabic: وَجَعَلَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورٗا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ سِرَاجٗا

data.price: Allah has produced you from the earth like a plant[5],
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ نَبَاتٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., your father Adam, whom Allah created from clay.

data.price: then He will return you into it and then will bring you out again.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمۡ فِيهَا وَيُخۡرِجُكُمۡ إِخۡرَاجٗا

data.price: Allah has made the earth widespread for you
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِسَاطٗا

data.price: so that you may tread its spacious paths[6].’”
data.arabic: لِّتَسۡلُكُواْ مِنۡهَا سُبُلٗا فِجَاجٗا
data.footnotes: [6] In the pursuit of a lawful livelihood.

data.price: Noah said, “My Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children did not increase them except in loss[7].
data.arabic: قَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمۡ عَصَوۡنِي وَٱتَّبَعُواْ مَن لَّمۡ يَزِدۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارٗا
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the lowly people among them followed their wealthy chiefs.

data.price: They have contrived a mighty plot,
data.arabic: وَمَكَرُواْ مَكۡرٗا كُبَّارٗا

data.price: They said, ‘Do not abandon your gods; and do not abandon Wadd, Suwā‘, Yaghūth, Ya‘ūq, and Nasr[8].’
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدّٗا وَلَا سُوَاعٗا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسۡرٗا
data.footnotes: [8] These were the names of idols named after pious men of past generations before the time of Noah, to commemorate them. In later generations, people started worshiping these idols.

data.price: They have led many astray. So [O Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.”
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ أَضَلُّواْ كَثِيرٗاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلٗا

data.price: Because of their sins, they were drowned and then were cast into the Fire, and they did not find any helpers against Allah.
data.arabic: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمۡ أُغۡرِقُواْ فَأُدۡخِلُواْ نَارٗا فَلَمۡ يَجِدُواْ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارٗا

data.price: Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave on earth a single disbeliever.
data.arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا

data.price: For if You leave them, they will surely lead Your slaves astray and beget none but wicked disbelievers.
data.arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرۡهُمۡ يُضِلُّواْ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓاْ إِلَّا فَاجِرٗا كَفَّارٗا

data.price: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in ruin.”
data.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيۡتِيَ مُؤۡمِنٗا وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارَۢا

data.price: Say, “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened [to the Qur’an,] and they said, ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation
data.arabic: قُلۡ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبٗا

data.price: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
data.arabic: يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدٗا

data.price: And that He – our exalted and glorified Lord[1] – has neither taken a wife nor a child;
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةٗ وَلَا وَلَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1] “Jadd” of Our Lord means His Glory, Grandeur, and Command.

data.price: and that the fool among us [i.e., Satan] used to say outrageous things about Allah[2],
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطٗا
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., Satan tempted humans to believe that Allah has a wife and children, and that the angels are Allah's daughters.

data.price: although we thought that humans and jinn would never tell lies about Allah.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا

data.price: And there were some men who used to seek refuge with some jinn, but they only increased them in burden.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقٗا

data.price: They thought, just like you [jinn] thought that Allah would never send any messenger.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن يَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٗا

data.price: We have sought to reach heaven but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fire.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدۡنَٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسٗا شَدِيدٗا وَشُهُبٗا

data.price: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but now anyone who eavesdrops will find a flaming fire waiting for him[3].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن يَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡأٓنَ يَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابٗا رَّصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [3] After the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sent as a messenger, the jinn who used to eavesdrop on heaven and then pass it on to fortune-tellers came to an end.

data.price: We do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends good for them.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِيٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدٗا

data.price: Among us are some who are righteous and some who are otherwise, for we follow divergent ways[4].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدٗا
data.footnotes: [4] In beliefs and religious duties.

data.price: We have realized that we can never escape Allah on earth, nor can we ever escape Him by fleeing.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبٗا

data.price: When we heard the guidance [of the Qur’an], we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord will have no fear of curtailment [from his reward] or injustice[5].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخۡسٗا وَلَا رَهَقٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., nor will the sins of another be placed upon him.

data.price: Among us are some who are Muslims and some who are deviant[6]. Those who accepted Islam have sought the true guidance,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوۡاْ رَشَدٗا
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., deviant from the right way.

data.price: but those who are deviant, they will be fuel for Hell.’”
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُواْ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبٗا

data.price: “If they had remained steadfast on the right way, We would have given them abundant rain,
data.arabic: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقٗا

data.price: as a test for them[7]. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[8], He will make him suffer an arduous punishment.
data.arabic: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابٗا صَعَدٗا
data.footnotes:
[7] As to whether they will be grateful for Allah's provisions or not.
 [8] i.e., the Qur’an and obedience to Him.

data.price: The mosques[9] are for Allah alone, so do not supplicate anyone along with Allah.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٗا
data.footnotes: [9] "Masjid" here means every place of worship on earth.

data.price: Yet when the slave of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they swarmed around him[10].”
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدۡعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِ لِبَدٗا
data.footnotes: [10] Crowding in the manner of locusts on top of one another in order to hear him (ﷺ). It refers to the jinn or to the Arabs pagans.

data.price: Say [O Prophet], “I only supplicate my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي وَلَآ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدٗا

data.price: Say, “I have no power to harm or benefit you[11].”
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَآ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرّٗا وَلَا رَشَدٗا
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., grant you goodness and guidance.

data.price: Say, “None can ever protect me from Allah [if I should disobey Him], nor can I ever find refuge except in Him.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٞ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا

data.price: I only convey what I receive from Allah and His messages.” And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger will certainly be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever.
data.arabic: إِلَّا بَلَٰغٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا

data.price: Until when they see what they were promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرٗا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدٗا

data.price: Say, “I do not know if what you are promised is near or my Lord has appointed a distant time for it.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِيٓ أَقَرِيبٞ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ يَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَمَدًا

data.price: [He is] the Knower of the unseen, He does not reveal His unseen to anyone,
data.arabic: عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَلَا يُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيۡبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا

data.price: except the messenger whom He chooses, then He appoints angel-guards before him and behind him[12]
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٖ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ يَدَيۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [12] Protecting him so that others do not know what he was informed of the unseen.

data.price: to ensure[13] that the messengers fully conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge all about them, and keeps count of all things.”
data.arabic: لِّيَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُواْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا
data.footnotes: [13] Or "So He may make evident."

data.price: O you the enwrapped one[1],
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُزَّمِّلُ
data.footnotes: [1] Allah is addressing the Messenger (ﷺ), who was wrapped in his garments.

data.price: Stand up in prayer at night except a little,
data.arabic: قُمِ ٱلَّيۡلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا

data.price: half of it, or a little less,
data.arabic: نِّصۡفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصۡ مِنۡهُ قَلِيلًا

data.price: or a little more, and recite the Qur’an at a measured pace.
data.arabic: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَيۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِيلًا

data.price: We will send down upon you a heavy Word[2].
data.arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلۡقِي عَلَيۡكَ قَوۡلٗا ثَقِيلًا
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., the revelation, which the Prophet (ﷺ) would feel its great weight when descending upon him. Also, it is heavy for its ordinances, rulings, punishments, ethics, etc.

data.price: Indeed, worship at night is more effective[3] and more conducive to proper recitation[4].
data.arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيۡلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـٔٗا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِيلًا
data.footnotes:
[3] Or "getting up at night is more difficult...," meaning that it can only be done by sincere believers.
 [4] i.e., for reciting, hearing, and understanding of the Qur’an.

data.price: In the daytime, you have plenty of time for your worldly matters.
data.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحٗا طَوِيلٗا

data.price: And remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself completely to Him.
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَيۡهِ تَبۡتِيلٗا

data.price: [He is] Lord of the east and the west; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, so take Him as the Disposer of your affairs[5].
data.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., trust in Allah and rely upon Him in all your matters.

data.price: Bear patiently what they say, and avoid them in a gracious manner.
data.arabic: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرٗا جَمِيلٗا

data.price: Leave to Me the deniers who are having a life of luxury, and bear with them for a little while.
data.arabic: وَذَرۡنِي وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ أُوْلِي ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِيلًا

data.price: Indeed, We have heavy shackles and a Blazing Fire,
data.arabic: إِنَّ لَدَيۡنَآ أَنكَالٗا وَجَحِيمٗا

data.price: and food that chokes, and a painful punishment,
data.arabic: وَطَعَامٗا ذَا غُصَّةٖ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمٗا

data.price: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will convulse, and the mountains will be like dunes of loose sand.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِيبٗا مَّهِيلًا

data.price: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger to be a witness over you, just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ رَسُولٗا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيۡكُمۡ كَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولٗا

data.price: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a severe punishment.
data.arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ أَخۡذٗا وَبِيلٗا

data.price: If you disbelieve, then how will you protect yourselves against a Day that will turn children’s hair gray?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ يَوۡمٗا يَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَٰنَ شِيبًا

data.price: It will cause the sky to break asunder[6]. His promise will certainly be fulfilled.
data.arabic: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا
data.footnotes: [6] Out of the terror of that Day.

data.price: Indeed, this is a reminder; so whoever wills may take a way to his Lord.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا

data.price: Indeed, your Lord knows that you [O Prophet] stand up in prayer for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, as do others among your companions. Allah determines the night and the day; He knows that you [Muslims] cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He pardoned you[7]. Recite then as much of the Qur’an as is easy for you [in the night prayers]. He knows that there are some among you who will be ill, and others traveling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and others fighting in Allah’s way. So recite as much of it as is easy for you; establish prayer and give zakah; and lend to Allah a goodly loan[8]. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, much better in condition and much greater in reward[9]. And seek forgiveness of Allah, for indeed Allah is All-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.
data.arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضۡرِبُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُواْ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٗا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرٗاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمُۢ
data.footnotes:
[7] The ruling mentioned at the beginning of this surah is lightened here. So from now on, the believers do not have to stick to any of the portions specified there; rather, they can pray whatever they can at night. It is out of the mercy of Allah upon His servants that He does not want hardship for them.
 [8] i.e., giving in charity and for His causes.
 [9] It will be rewarded tenfold, or 700-fold, and Allah gives even more to whoever He wills. See 2:261.

data.price: O you covered [in your cloak][1],
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُدَّثِّرُ
data.footnotes: [1] It refers to the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: arise and warn,
data.arabic: قُمۡ فَأَنذِرۡ

data.price: and proclaim the greatness of your Lord,
data.arabic: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرۡ

data.price: and purify your garments,
data.arabic: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرۡ

data.price: and shun idol worshiping[2],
data.arabic: وَٱلرُّجۡزَ فَٱهۡجُرۡ
data.footnotes: [2] And other sins and bad conducts and morals.

data.price: and do not do a favor for a greater return[3],
data.arabic: وَلَا تَمۡنُن تَسۡتَكۡثِرُ
data.footnotes: [3] Or: do not consider your good deeds as a favor to Allah, thinking of your little deeds as abundant.

data.price: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.
data.arabic: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصۡبِرۡ

data.price: When the Trumpet is sounded[4],
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي ٱلنَّاقُورِ
data.footnotes: [4] For the second time, causing all to rise from the dead for resurrection. See 39:68.

data.price: that Day will be a difficult day,
data.arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَوۡمٌ عَسِيرٌ

data.price: not easy for the disbelievers.
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ غَيۡرُ يَسِيرٖ

data.price: Leave me to deal with the one whom I created lonely[5],
data.arabic: ذَرۡنِي وَمَنۡ خَلَقۡتُ وَحِيدٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., having no wealth or children. It refers to al-Walīd bin al-Mughīrah, who was impressed by the Qur’an, yet he publicly denied it to win the approval of the pagans of Makkah.

data.price: and gave him abundant wealth,
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡتُ لَهُۥ مَالٗا مَّمۡدُودٗا

data.price: and sons by his side,
data.arabic: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودٗا

data.price: and gave him a life of comfort and power,
data.arabic: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمۡهِيدٗا

data.price: yet he aspires that I should give him more.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يَطۡمَعُ أَنۡ أَزِيدَ

data.price: By no means! For he has been stubborn against Our verses.
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِأٓيَٰتِنَا عَنِيدٗا

data.price: I will subject him to an unbearable punishment.
data.arabic: سَأُرۡهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا

data.price: For he reflected and plotted [against the Qur’an][6].
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
data.footnotes: [6] In order to discredit it.

data.price: May he perish, how he plotted!
data.arabic: فَقُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ

data.price: Again, may he perish, how he plotted!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ

data.price: Then he looked around,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ

data.price: then he frowned and scowled,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ

data.price: then turned away with arrogance,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ

data.price: then said, “This is nothing but magic from the past.
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ

data.price: This is nothing but the words of a man.”
data.arabic: إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوۡلُ ٱلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: Soon I will make him burn in the Scorching Fire[7].
data.arabic: سَأُصۡلِيهِ سَقَرَ
data.footnotes: [7] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.

data.price: How do you know what Scorching Fire is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ

data.price: It leaves nothing and spares no one,
data.arabic: لَا تُبۡقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ

data.price: scorching the skin.
data.arabic: لَوَّاحَةٞ لِّلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: It is overseen by nineteen [angels].
data.arabic: عَلَيۡهَا تِسۡعَةَ عَشَرَ

data.price: We have only appointed angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have only made their number as a test for the disbelievers[8], so that those who were given the Scripture may have certainty and the believers may increase in faith; and neither those who were given the Scripture nor the believers may have any doubts; and so that those [hypocrites] in whose hearts is sickness and the disbelievers may say, “What does Allah mean by this number?” Thus Allah causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills, and none knows the soldiers of your Lord but He. This is but a reminder to mankind.
data.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ
data.footnotes: [8] To say what they want to say, so their punishment will be multiplied for them. Abu Jahl, one of the chief pagans in Makkah, made fun of the Prophet (ﷺ) when they came to know that the keepers of Hell are nineteen angels, so he ridiculed this number and said that it is an easy number to overcome.

data.price: No indeed! By the moon,
data.arabic: كَلَّا وَٱلۡقَمَرِ

data.price: and by the night when it departs,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذۡ أَدۡبَرَ

data.price: and by the dawn when it brightens,
data.arabic: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَآ أَسۡفَرَ

data.price: Hellfire is indeed one of the greatest matters,
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا لَإِحۡدَى ٱلۡكُبَرِ

data.price: a warning to mankind,
data.arabic: نَذِيرٗا لِّلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: to whoever among you chooses to advance or regress.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ

data.price: Every soul is held in pledge[9] for its deeds,
data.arabic: كُلُّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡ رَهِينَةٌ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., held responsible.

data.price: except the People of the Right[10],
data.arabic: إِلَّآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., the believers who receive their records of deeds in their right hands.

data.price: who will be in gardens, asking one another
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: about the wicked:
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: “What brought you to Hell?”
data.arabic: مَا سَلَكَكُمۡ فِي سَقَرَ

data.price: They will say, “We were not among those who prayed,
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَمۡ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُصَلِّينَ

data.price: nor did we feed the poor,
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ نَكُ نُطۡعِمُ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينَ

data.price: and we indulged in falsehood along with those who indulged in it,
data.arabic: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلۡخَآئِضِينَ

data.price: and we denied the Day of Judgment,
data.arabic: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: until the certainty [of death] came to us.”
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلۡيَقِينُ

data.price: So the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.
data.arabic: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمۡ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ

data.price: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from the Reminder,
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلتَّذۡكِرَةِ مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: as if they were terrified wild asses,
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمۡ حُمُرٞ مُّسۡتَنفِرَةٞ

data.price: fleeing from a lion?
data.arabic: فَرَّتۡ مِن قَسۡوَرَةِۭ

data.price: In fact, each one of them desires that open [divine] letters be sent to each of them[11].
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ
data.footnotes: [11] Instead of Muhammad (ﷺ), not due to the lack of proofs or signs presented to them but out of obstinacy and arrogance.

data.price: By no means! They rather do not fear the Hereafter.
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ

data.price: No indeed! This [Qur’an] is a reminder.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذۡكِرَةٞ

data.price: So whoever wills may take heed.
data.arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

data.price: But they will not take heed unless Allah so wills. He is most worthy to be feared and most worthy to forgive.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ

data.price: I swear by the Day of Resurrection,
data.arabic: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ

data.price: and I swear by the self-reproaching soul[1]!
data.arabic: وَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلنَّفۡسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
data.footnotes: [1] Of the believer, which blames oneself whenever falls into sin or error.

data.price: Does man think that We cannot reassemble his bones?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجۡمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ

data.price: In fact, We are able to restore even his very fingertips.
data.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ

data.price: But man desires to persist in sin[2],
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفۡجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [2] While denying the coming of the Day of Judgment.

data.price: and asks [mockingly], “When is the Day of Resurrection?”
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ

data.price: But when the sight is dazzled,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ

data.price: and the moon is darkened,
data.arabic: وَخَسَفَ ٱلۡقَمَرُ

data.price: and the sun and the moon are brought together[3],
data.arabic: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ
data.footnotes: [3] They both have never been together since they were created. On this Day they will be brought together, darkened, and both will be thrown into the Hell; so that all should know that they were subservient created beings, especially those who worshiped them.

data.price: on that Day man will say, “Where is the escape?”
data.arabic: يَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذٍ أَيۡنَ ٱلۡمَفَرُّ

data.price: No indeed! There will be no refuge.
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ

data.price: On that Day all will end up before your Lord.
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقَرُّ

data.price: On that Day man will be informed of what he has sent forth[4] and left behind[5].
data.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
data.footnotes:
[4] i.e., of his deeds for the Hereafter.
 [5] i.e., that which he failed to do.

data.price: In fact, man will be a witness against himself[6],
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٞ
data.footnotes: [6] His organs will testify against him, as mentioned in 36:65 and 41:20-23.

data.price: despite the excuses he may put forward.
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ أَلۡقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ

data.price: Do not move your tongue [O Prophet] in haste trying to memorize it.
data.arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ

data.price: It is upon Us to make you memorize and recite it.
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا جَمۡعَهُۥ وَقُرۡءَانَهُۥ

data.price: Then when We recite it [through Gabriel], follow its recitation attentively;
data.arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأۡنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعۡ قُرۡءَانَهُۥ

data.price: then it is upon Us to explain its meanings.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا بَيَانَهُۥ

data.price: No indeed! You [people] love this fleeting world,
data.arabic: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ

data.price: and neglect the Hereafter.
data.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ

data.price: On that Day some faces will be bright,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاضِرَةٌ

data.price: looking at their Lord[7].
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٞ
data.footnotes: [7] The dwellers of Paradise will be granted the honor of actually seeing their Lord in the Hereafter.

data.price: And on that Day, some faces will be gloomy,
data.arabic: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بَاسِرَةٞ

data.price: knowing that a crushing calamity will befall them.
data.arabic: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفۡعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٞ

data.price: Indeed, when the soul reaches the throat[8],
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِيَ
data.footnotes: [8] Upon death.

data.price: and it is said, “Is there any healer?”
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ مَنۡۜ رَاقٖ

data.price: And he realizes that it is time to depart,
data.arabic: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡفِرَاقُ

data.price: when legs are brought together [in a shroud][9];
data.arabic: وَٱلۡتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
data.footnotes: [9] The difficulties the person faces while leaving this world and moving on to the Hereafter; or the people arrange for the departure of his body, while angels arrange for the departure of his soul.

data.price: on that Day, he will be driven to your Lord.
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمَسَاقُ

data.price: He neither believed nor prayed;
data.arabic: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ

data.price: rather he denied and turned away,
data.arabic: وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: then he went to his people, elated with pride,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ

data.price: Woe to you, and woe!
data.arabic: أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰ

data.price: Again, woe to you, and woe!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰٓ

data.price: Does man think that he will be left neglected[10]?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتۡرَكَ سُدًى
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., without purpose and responsibility, or without returning to Allah for account.

data.price: Was he not once a drop of semen emitted,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: then he became a clinging clot[11], then He created him and perfected his form,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةٗ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
data.footnotes: [11] "‘Alaqah": an embryo that resembles a leech.

data.price: and made from him both genders, male and female?
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡهُ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ

data.price: Is not He able to bring the dead back to life?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

data.price: Was there not a period of time when man was not a thing [even] mentioned[1]?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا
data.footnotes: [1] Before coming into being.

data.price: Indeed, We created man from a drop of mixed fluids[2], in order to test him. So We gave him hearing and sight.
data.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
data.footnotes: [2] A combination of male and female gametes (sperm and egg) which form the zygote after fertilization in the womb.

data.price: Indeed, We showed him the way, whether he is grateful or ungrateful.
data.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

data.price: We have surely prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] flavored with camphor[3],
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
data.footnotes: [3] "Kāfoor": a sweet-scent spring in Paradise.

data.price: a spring from which Allah’s slaves will drink, which will flow as they wish.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا

data.price: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will spread far and wide,
data.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا

data.price: and they give food, despite their love for it[4], to the needy, the orphans, and the captives,
data.arabic: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
data.footnotes: [4] Or "out of love for Him (Allah)".

data.price: [saying to themselves] “We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we seek from you neither reward nor gratitude.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا

data.price: We fear from our Lord a grim and distressful Day.”
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا

data.price: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day, and will grant them radiance and delight,
data.arabic: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا

data.price: and will reward them for their perseverance with Paradise and garments of silk.
data.arabic: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُواْ جَنَّةٗ وَحَرِيرٗا

data.price: They will recline therein on adorned couches; neither feeling scorching heat[5] nor freezing cold.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the sun.

data.price: with shady branches spread above them, and clusters of fruit will be made within their reach.
data.arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا

data.price: They will be served frequently with silver vessels and crystal cups,
data.arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠

data.price: crystalline goblets of silver, filled precisely as desired.
data.arabic: قَوَارِيرَاْ مِن فِضَّةٖ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِيرٗا

data.price: They will be given a glass [of wine] flavored with ginger
data.arabic: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا

data.price: from a spring therein called Salsabīl.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِيلٗا

data.price: They will be served by eternal young boys; if you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا

data.price: If you were to look around, you would see bliss and a vast dominion.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا

data.price: They will be dressed in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.
data.arabic: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا

data.price: [And they will be told,] “Indeed, this is your reward, and your efforts have been appreciated.”
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا

data.price: Indeed, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’an to you in stages.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا

data.price: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not obey any sinner or disbeliever from among them.
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا

data.price: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening[6],
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةٗ وَأَصِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [6] This and the next verse refer to the five daily prayers: here it refers to the dawn prayer, then the noon and afternoon prayers.

data.price: and prostrate to Him at night, and glorify Him at length by night[7].
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا
data.footnotes: [7] It refers to the sunset and night prayers.

data.price: Indeed, these [pagans] love this fleeting life and pay no heed to a heavy Day ahead of them.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا

data.price: It is We Who created them and strengthened their build. If We will, We can replace them with others like them.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا

data.price: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who wills may take a way to his Lord.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا

data.price: But you cannot will unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا

data.price: He admits whom He wills into His mercy, but for the wrongdoers He has prepared a painful punishment.
data.arabic: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا

data.price: By those [winds] sent forth in succession,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمُرۡسَلَٰتِ عُرۡفٗا

data.price: those that blow violently,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصۡفٗا

data.price: and scatter [rainclouds] far and wide,
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشۡرٗا

data.price: And by those [angels] who bring criterion[1];
data.arabic: فَٱلۡفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرۡقٗا
data.footnotes: [1] To Allah's messengers to distinguish between truth and falsehood.

data.price: and those who deliver revelation,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُلۡقِيَٰتِ ذِكۡرًا

data.price: leaving no excuse or giving warning –
data.arabic: عُذۡرًا أَوۡ نُذۡرًا

data.price: what you are promised will surely come to pass.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: So when the stars are effaced,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتۡ

data.price: and when the sky is split apart,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتۡ

data.price: and when the mountains are blown away,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ نُسِفَتۡ

data.price: and when the messengers are summoned[2],
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتۡ
data.footnotes: [2] To testify concerning their nations.

data.price: until which Day has all this been postponed?
data.arabic: لِأَيِّ يَوۡمٍ أُجِّلَتۡ

data.price: Until the Day of Judgment.
data.arabic: لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

data.price: How do you know what the Day of Judgment is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers[3]!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., Death and destruction be upon them.

data.price: Did We not destroy the earlier nations?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نُهۡلِكِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: Then We will do likewise to the later ones.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ نُتۡبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: This is how We deal with the wicked.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: Did We not create you from a worthless fluid,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَخۡلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٖ مَّهِينٖ

data.price: then We placed it in a secure repository
data.arabic: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ فِي قَرَارٖ مَّكِينٍ

data.price: for a determined period[4]?
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ

data.price: For We determined it; How excellently We determine!
data.arabic: فَقَدَرۡنَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡقَٰدِرُونَ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: Have We not made the earth a receptacle[5]
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ كِفَاتًا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., a lodging, a container that contains all people.

data.price: for the living and the dead,
data.arabic: أَحۡيَآءٗ وَأَمۡوَٰتٗا

data.price: and placed therein firm towering mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: [They will be told,] “Proceed to that [Fire] which you used to deny!
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: Proceed to the shadow [of smoke] ascending in three columns,
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ

data.price: that provides neither shade nor protection from the flames.
data.arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

data.price: Indeed, it [i.e., Hell] throws up sparks as big as castles,
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا تَرۡمِي بِشَرَرٖ كَٱلۡقَصۡرِ

data.price: as if they were tawny camels[6].
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَٰلَتٞ صُفۡرٞ
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., huge and black camels.

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: On that Day they won’t speak,
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ

data.price: nor will they be allowed to make excuses.
data.arabic: وَلَا يُؤۡذَنُ لَهُمۡ فَيَعۡتَذِرُونَ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: [They will be told,] “This is the Day of Judgment: We have gathered you along with the earlier generations.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِۖ جَمَعۡنَٰكُمۡ وَٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: So if you have any scheme, then plot it against Me.”
data.arabic: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ كَيۡدٞ فَكِيدُونِ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will be amid shades and springs
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَٰلٖ وَعُيُونٖ

data.price: and will have whatever fruit they desire.
data.arabic: وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully, as a reward for what you used to do.”
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: This is how We reward those who do good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while; you are truly wicked.”
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَتَمَتَّعُواْ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: When it is said to them, “Bow [in prayer],” they do not bow.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: In which message after this [Qur’an] will they believe?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثِۭ بَعۡدَهُۥ يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: About what are they asking one another?
data.arabic: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: About the momentous news[1],
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the Resurrection.

data.price: that which they differ about[2].
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي هُمۡ فِيهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ
data.footnotes: [2] The pagans of Makkah denied the Qur’an, resurrection, and judgment. They differed as to whether the Qur’an was magic, fortune-telling, or poetry.

data.price: No indeed; they will come to know.
data.arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: Again no; they will come to know.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: Have We not made the earth a resting place?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ مِهَٰدٗا

data.price: And the mountains as stakes[3],
data.arabic: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَوۡتَادٗا
data.footnotes: [3] Mountains go deep below the surface like pegs and icebergs, stabilizing the earth and slowing tectonic movement.

data.price: and created you in pairs,
data.arabic: وَخَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا

data.price: and made your sleep for rest,
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا نَوۡمَكُمۡ سُبَاتٗا

data.price: and made the night a covering[4],
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلَّيۡلَ لِبَاسٗا
data.footnotes: [4] Covering you in its darkness as garments cover you.

data.price: and made the day for seeking a livelihood,
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشٗا

data.price: and built above you seven mighty heavens,
data.arabic: وَبَنَيۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعٗا شِدَادٗا

data.price: and made therein a blazing lamp,
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا سِرَاجٗا وَهَّاجٗا

data.price: and sent down from the rainclouds abundant water,
data.arabic: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُعۡصِرَٰتِ مَآءٗ ثَجَّاجٗا

data.price: so that We may produce thereby grains and vegetation,
data.arabic: لِّنُخۡرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبّٗا وَنَبَاتٗا

data.price: and gardens with dense foliage?
data.arabic: وَجَنَّٰتٍ أَلۡفَافًا

data.price: Indeed, the Day of Judgment is a time appointed,
data.arabic: إِنَّ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ كَانَ مِيقَٰتٗا

data.price: the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, you will come forth in crowds,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُنفَخُ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجٗا

data.price: and the sky will be opened up and will become gateways,
data.arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ أَبۡوَٰبٗا

data.price: and the mountains will vanish, becoming like a mirage.
data.arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ فَكَانَتۡ سَرَابًا

data.price: Indeed, Hell is lying in wait,
data.arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتۡ مِرۡصَادٗا

data.price: a resort for the transgressors,
data.arabic: لِّلطَّٰغِينَ مَـَٔابٗا

data.price: wherein they will abide for endless ages.
data.arabic: لَّٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحۡقَابٗا

data.price: They will neither taste therein any coolness nor any drink,
data.arabic: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرۡدٗا وَلَا شَرَابًا

data.price: except for scalding water and discharge of wounds,
data.arabic: إِلَّا حَمِيمٗا وَغَسَّاقٗا

data.price: a fitting recompense[5].
data.arabic: جَزَآءٗ وِفَاقًا
data.footnotes: [5] To their disbelief and evil deeds.

data.price: Indeed, they did not expect a reckoning,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ لَا يَرۡجُونَ حِسَابٗا

data.price: and utterly rejected Our verses.
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كِذَّابٗا

data.price: But We have enumerated everything in a record[6].
data.arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيۡءٍ أَحۡصَيۡنَٰهُ كِتَٰبٗا
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., a record of deeds.

data.price: So taste [the punishment], for We will not increase you except in torment[7].”
data.arabic: فَذُوقُواْ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمۡ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
data.footnotes: [7] The addressees are the dwellers of Hell.

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will have salvation[8],
data.arabic: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., safety from Hell and winning Paradise.

data.price: gardens and vineyards,
data.arabic: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعۡنَٰبٗا

data.price: and full-bosomed maidens of equal age,
data.arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتۡرَابٗا

data.price: and a full cup [of wine][9].
data.arabic: وَكَأۡسٗا دِهَاقٗا
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., tasteful wine which neither intoxicates nor causes headache.

data.price: They will not hear therein vain talk or lies –
data.arabic: لَّا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا كِذَّٰبٗا

data.price: a reward and a generous gift from your Lord[10],
data.arabic: جَزَآءٗ مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابٗا
data.footnotes: [10] Or "a gift adequately calculated"; as a result of their righteous deeds as well as the ample generosity of Allah.

data.price: [from] the Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, the Most Compassionate; none will dare to speak to Him[11].
data.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۖ لَا يَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابٗا
data.footnotes: [11] None can ask or plead on the Day of Judgment except by Allah's permission.

data.price: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows; none will dare to speak, except those to whom the Most Compassionate granted permission, and they will only speak the truth.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفّٗاۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابٗا

data.price: That Day is sure to come. So whoever wills may seek a path leading to his Lord[12].
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., the path of guidance and righteous deeds.

data.price: Indeed, We have warned you of an imminent punishment on the Day when everyone will see what his hands have sent forth[13], and the disbeliever will say, “Oh, I wish that I were dust!”
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنذَرۡنَٰكُمۡ عَذَابٗا قَرِيبٗا يَوۡمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَٰبَۢا
data.footnotes: [13] i.e., the deeds he did in this world.

data.price: By those who pull out [evil souls][1] harshly,
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰزِعَٰتِ غَرۡقٗا
data.footnotes: [1] Of the disbelievers.

data.price: and by those who draw out [good souls][2] gently,
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰشِطَٰتِ نَشۡطٗا
data.footnotes: [2] Of the believers.

data.price: and by those who glide swiftly[3],
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّٰبِحَٰتِ سَبۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., angels glide swiftly through the heavens and earth with Allah’s command.

data.price: and those who overtake one another as in a race[4],
data.arabic: فَٱلسَّٰبِقَٰتِ سَبۡقٗا
data.footnotes: [4] To execute Allah's commands.

data.price: and those who carry out the command [of Allah],
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمۡرٗا

data.price: on the Day when the earth convulses [by the first Blast],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ

data.price: followed by the second Blast,
data.arabic: تَتۡبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ

data.price: hearts[5] will be pounding on that Day,
data.arabic: قُلُوبٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَاجِفَةٌ
data.footnotes: [5] Of those who denied the Resurrection.

data.price: and their eyes[6] will be downcast.
data.arabic: أَبۡصَٰرُهَا خَٰشِعَةٞ
data.footnotes: [6] Of the disbelievers.

data.price: They say, “Will we be brought back to life,
data.arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرۡدُودُونَ فِي ٱلۡحَافِرَةِ

data.price: after we have turned into decayed bones[7]?”
data.arabic: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَٰمٗا نَّخِرَةٗ
data.footnotes: [7] They would say this in ridicule of the warning.

data.price: They say, “Then that would surely be a losing return[8]!”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ تِلۡكَ إِذٗا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٞ
data.footnotes: [8] To one another.

data.price: It will only be a single Blast,
data.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ

data.price: then they will immediately be above the ground.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ

data.price: Has there come to you the story of Moses,
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ

data.price: when his Lord called out to him at the sacred valley of Tuwa?
data.arabic: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

data.price: [Saying,] “Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds”.
data.arabic: ٱذۡهَبۡ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ

data.price: And say: ‘Are you willing to be purified,
data.arabic: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: and I will guide you to your Lord so that you may fear Him?’”
data.arabic: وَأَهۡدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: Then Moses showed him the greatest sign[9].
data.arabic: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلۡأٓيَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., the miracle of the staff turning into a snake. See 20:17-23.

data.price: But Pharaoh denied it and disobeyed.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ

data.price: Then he turned back striving to plot.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ يَسۡعَىٰ

data.price: He gathered [his people] and proclaimed,
data.arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ

data.price: saying, “I am your lord, the most high.”
data.arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: So Allah seized him for an exemplary punishment in this life and in the Hereafter[10].
data.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [10] Or for his claim of being the greatest god and for his previous oppression of the Children of Israel.

data.price: Indeed, there is a lesson in this for those who fear Allah.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبۡرَةٗ لِّمَن يَخۡشَىٰٓ

data.price: Are you more difficult to create or the heaven that He built?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا

data.price: He raised its vault high and proportioned it,
data.arabic: رَفَعَ سَمۡكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا

data.price: and darkened its night and brought forth its daylight.
data.arabic: وَأَغۡطَشَ لَيۡلَهَا وَأَخۡرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا

data.price: And thereafter He spread out the earth,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ

data.price: brought forth from it its water and its pasture,
data.arabic: أَخۡرَجَ مِنۡهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرۡعَىٰهَا

data.price: and set the mountains firmly,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَرۡسَىٰهَا

data.price: as a provision for you and your grazing livestock.
data.arabic: مَتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ

data.price: But when the Supreme Calamity comes[11],
data.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., the second Blast which marks the Day of judgment.

data.price: on that Day man will remember all what he did,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ

data.price: and the Blazing Fire will be exposed for all to see.
data.arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ

data.price: As for those who transgressed,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ

data.price: and preferred the life of this world,
data.arabic: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: the Blazing Fire will be their abode.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

data.price: But those who feared standing before their Lord and restrained themselves from evil desires,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ

data.price: Paradise will surely be their abode.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

data.price: They ask you concerning the Hour, “When will it be[12]?”
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرۡسَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [12] Lit., "established."

data.price: How could you possibly mention that?
data.arabic: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكۡرَىٰهَآ

data.price: Its knowledge rests only with your Lord[13].
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ
data.footnotes: [13] i.e., its end and termination. Its ultimate knowledge belongs to Allah alone.

data.price: You are only a warner for those who fear it.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰهَا

data.price: On the Day when they see it[14], it will be as if they had remained [in this world] no more than an evening or a morning.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَ يَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ يَلۡبَثُوٓاْ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [14] i.e., the Hour.

data.price: He frowned and turned away,
data.arabic: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: when the blind man came to him[1].
data.arabic: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1] Abdullah ibn Um Maktūm, an early Muslim who was blind, came to the Prophet (ﷺ) seeking to learn, while the Prophet (ﷺ) was in the middle of a discussion with a leading pagan of Makkah, calling him to Islam. Abdullah was so impatient that he interrupted their discussion. The Prophet (ﷺ) frowned and turned his attention to that pagan. So this Makkan surah was revealed, telling the Prophet (ﷺ) that the faithful blind man was more worthy of attention than that disbeliever.

data.price: How would you know? Perhaps he might be purified[2],
data.arabic: وَمَا يُدۡرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [2] Through the knowledge he learns from you.

data.price: or he might take heed and benefit from the reminder?
data.arabic: أَوۡ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰٓ

data.price: But he who was indifferent[3],
data.arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ
data.footnotes: [3] Towards faith. Here it is referring to that influential pagan of the Quraysh whom the Prophet (ﷺ) had hoped to embrace Islam.

data.price: you give him your full attention,
data.arabic: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ

data.price: although you are not to be blamed if he does not purify himself[4].
data.arabic: وَمَا عَلَيۡكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
data.footnotes: [4] The Prophets are only responsible to convey the message, not for people’s guidance.

data.price: But as for the one who came to you striving [for purification],
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسۡعَىٰ

data.price: and he fears Allah,
data.arabic: وَهُوَ يَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: you let yourself be distracted from him.
data.arabic: فَأَنتَ عَنۡهُ تَلَهَّىٰ

data.price: No indeed; this is a reminder –
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذۡكِرَةٞ

data.price: so whoever wills may give heed to it –
data.arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

data.price: on venerable pages,
data.arabic: فِي صُحُفٖ مُّكَرَّمَةٖ

data.price: exalted and purified,
data.arabic: مَّرۡفُوعَةٖ مُّطَهَّرَةِۭ

data.price: [preserved] in the hands of angel-scribes,
data.arabic: بِأَيۡدِي سَفَرَةٖ

data.price: honorable and obedient.
data.arabic: كِرَامِۭ بَرَرَةٖ

data.price: Woe to man; how ungrateful he is[5]!
data.arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَآ أَكۡفَرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the disbelievers.

data.price: From what did He create him?
data.arabic: مِنۡ أَيِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ

data.price: He created him from a drop of semen and proportioned him[6],
data.arabic: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [6] His creation, provisions, life span, etc.

data.price: then He made the way easy for him[7];
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the way out of his mothers’ wombs (his birth), or the way to guidance.

data.price: then He caused him to die and be buried;
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقۡبَرَهُۥ

data.price: then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ

data.price: Yet he has not fulfilled what He commanded him.
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقۡضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ

data.price: Let man consider the food he eats:
data.arabic: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ

data.price: How We pour down rainwater in torrents,
data.arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبۡنَا ٱلۡمَآءَ صَبّٗا

data.price: and cause the soil to split open [for sprouts],
data.arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ شَقّٗا

data.price: and cause grains to grow in it,
data.arabic: فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا حَبّٗا

data.price: as well as grapes and fodder,
data.arabic: وَعِنَبٗا وَقَضۡبٗا

data.price: and olive trees and date palms,
data.arabic: وَزَيۡتُونٗا وَنَخۡلٗا

data.price: and dense orchards,
data.arabic: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلۡبٗا

data.price: and fruits and grass,
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٗ وَأَبّٗا

data.price: as provision for you and your livestock.
data.arabic: مَّتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ

data.price: But when the Deafening Blast[8] comes,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ
data.footnotes: [8] The piercing Blast; the second Blast for resurrection.

data.price: on that Day everyone will flee from his brother,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مِنۡ أَخِيهِ

data.price: and from his mother and father,
data.arabic: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ

data.price: and from his wife and children.
data.arabic: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ

data.price: On that day, everyone will have enough concern of his own[9].
data.arabic: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ شَأۡنٞ يُغۡنِيهِ
data.footnotes: [9] Thus forgetting all others.

data.price: On that Day, some faces will be bright,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ مُّسۡفِرَةٞ

data.price: cheerful and rejoicing;
data.arabic: ضَاحِكَةٞ مُّسۡتَبۡشِرَةٞ

data.price: while other faces will be dust-stained,
data.arabic: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَلَيۡهَا غَبَرَةٞ

data.price: covered in darkness.
data.arabic: تَرۡهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ

data.price: Such are the disbelievers, the wicked.
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡكَفَرَةُ ٱلۡفَجَرَةُ

data.price: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness,
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ كُوِّرَتۡ

data.price: and when the stars fall down,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتۡ

data.price: and when the mountains are set in motion,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتۡ

data.price: and when pregnant camels[1] are left unattended,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1] Which are near delivery. It alludes to the distraction of people from their most valuable possessions, such as ten-month pregnant camels for nomadic Arabs.

data.price: and when wild beasts are gathered,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتۡ

data.price: and when the seas are set on fire,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتۡ

data.price: and when the souls are sorted[2],
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتۡ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., "joined" with their groups or sects, wicked with the wicked souls, righteous with the righteous.

data.price: and when the baby girl buried alive[3] is asked,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡمَوۡءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتۡ
data.footnotes: [3] As the pagan Arabs used to do for fear of shame or poverty. The Qur’an condemned this practice. See 16:58-59.

data.price: for what crime she was killed,
data.arabic: بِأَيِّ ذَنۢبٖ قُتِلَتۡ

data.price: and when records of deeds are spread open,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتۡ

data.price: and when the sky is stripped away[4],
