data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتۡ
data.footnotes: [4] As the skin of sheep is stripped away.

data.price: and when the Blazing Fire is flared up,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتۡ

data.price: and when Paradise is brought near –
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَنَّةُ أُزۡلِفَتۡ

data.price: then every soul will know what it has brought about[5].
data.arabic: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّآ أَحۡضَرَتۡ
data.footnotes: [5] Of faith or disbelief, good or bad deeds for that Day.

data.price: I swear by the receding stars,
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلۡخُنَّسِ

data.price: that rise and hide[6],
data.arabic: ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡكُنَّسِ
data.footnotes: [6] This probably refers to black holes in the sky. "Kanasa" means sweeping or hiding.

data.price: and by the night as it departs,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا عَسۡعَسَ

data.price: and by the day as it breaks –
data.arabic: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ

data.price: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a word conveyed by a noble angel-messenger.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولٖ كَرِيمٖ

data.price: extremely powerful, highly revered by the Lord of the Throne,
data.arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ

data.price: obeyed there [by other angels] and trustworthy.
data.arabic: مُّطَاعٖ ثَمَّ أَمِينٖ

data.price: Your fellow [i.e., the Prophet] is not a madman.
data.arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجۡنُونٖ

data.price: He indeed saw him [i.e., Gabriel] on the clear horizon[7].
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡمُبِينِ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote 53:6

data.price: He does not withhold [knowledge of] the unseen[8].
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلۡغَيۡبِ بِضَنِينٖ
data.footnotes: [8] He (ﷺ) did not withhold the unseen which Allah had revealed to him in the Qur’an.

data.price: This [Qur’an] is not the word of an accursed devil.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَيۡطَٰنٖ رَّجِيمٖ

data.price: So which way are you going[9]?
data.arabic: فَأَيۡنَ تَذۡهَبُونَ
data.footnotes: [9] In your denial of the Qur’an for being the revelation from Allah.

data.price: It is but a reminder to the worlds,
data.arabic: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: for those among you who wish to take the straight path.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَسۡتَقِيمَ

data.price: But you cannot wish except by the Will of Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: When the sky breaks apart.
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتۡ

data.price: and when the stars fall, scattered,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتۡ

data.price: and when the seas burst forth,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتۡ

data.price: and when the graves are overturned,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡقُبُورُ بُعۡثِرَتۡ

data.price: then each soul will come to know what it has done or what it has left undone.
data.arabic: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ وَأَخَّرَتۡ

data.price: O mankind, what has lured you away from your Lord, the Most Generous,
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡكَرِيمِ

data.price: Who created you, then shaped and proportioned you,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ

data.price: and assembled you in whatever form He willed?
data.arabic: فِيٓ أَيِّ صُورَةٖ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ

data.price: No indeed; but you deny the Judgment Day,
data.arabic: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: while there are watchers[1] over you,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكُمۡ لَحَٰفِظِينَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., angels who preserve all your deeds.

data.price: honorable scribes,
data.arabic: كِرَامٗا كَٰتِبِينَ

data.price: who know whatever you do.
data.arabic: يَعۡلَمُونَ مَا تَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will be in Bliss,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٖ

data.price: and the wicked will be in Blazing Fire,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلۡفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٖ

data.price: which they will enter on Judgment Day,
data.arabic: يَصۡلَوۡنَهَا يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: and will never come out of it.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ

data.price: How do you know what Judgment Day is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: Again, how do you know what Judgment Day is?
data.arabic: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: It is the Day when no soul will be of any help to another, and all command on that Day will be with Allah.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا تَمۡلِكُ نَفۡسٞ لِّنَفۡسٖ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلَّهِ

data.price: Woe to the defrauders[1],
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِينَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., those who cheat people by giving them less in sale transactions, an amount so little as to hardly be noticed.

data.price: those who take full measure when they take from others,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُواْ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسۡتَوۡفُونَ

data.price: but they give less when they measure or weigh for them.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمۡ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمۡ يُخۡسِرُونَ

data.price: Do they really not think that they will be resurrected
data.arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: for a momentous Day,
data.arabic: لِيَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: a Day when people will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: No indeed! The record of the wicked is surely in Sijjīn.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٖ

data.price: How do you know what Sijjīn is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٞ

data.price: It is a clearly inscribed Record.
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers,
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: those who deny the Judgment Day!
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: None denies it except every sinful transgressor.
data.arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ

data.price: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables[2]!”
data.arabic: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., tales of old times, legends of former peoples.

data.price: No indeed! Their hearts have been stained by what they used to commit[3]!
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., their sins and evil deeds.

data.price: No indeed! On that Day they will be barred from seeing their Lord[4].
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ
data.footnotes: [4] As a punishment, since the believers will see Him.

data.price: They will then surely enter the Blazing Fire,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمۡ لَصَالُواْ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: then they will be told, “This is what you used to deny.”
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: No indeed! The record of the righteous is certainly in ‘illiyyīn –
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ

data.price: and how do you know what ‘illiyyūn is? –
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ

data.price: It is a record inscribed,
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ

data.price: witnessed by those who are close to Allah.
data.arabic: يَشۡهَدُهُ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will be in Bliss,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ

data.price: seated on the couches, gazing in wonder.
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: You will see on their faces the radiance of bliss.
data.arabic: تَعۡرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمۡ نَضۡرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: They will be served to drink pure wine from a sealed container,
data.arabic: يُسۡقَوۡنَ مِن رَّحِيقٖ مَّخۡتُومٍ

data.price: whose last sip is musk[5] – let those who strive, strive for that –
data.arabic: خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكٞۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلۡيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., having a lingering odor.

data.price: and it will be mixed with water from the spring of Tasnīm[6],
data.arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسۡنِيمٍ
data.footnotes: [6] It is the highest spring in Paradise.

data.price: a spring from which those who are close to Allah will drink.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: Indeed, the wicked used to laugh at the believers;
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجۡرَمُواْ كَانُواْ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ يَضۡحَكُونَ

data.price: when they passed by them, they would wink at one another,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّواْ بِهِمۡ يَتَغَامَزُونَ

data.price: and when they went back to their people, they would return exulting.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓاْ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُواْ فَكِهِينَ

data.price: When they saw the believers, they would say, “These people are truly misguided,”
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ

data.price: although they were not sent as their keepers.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أُرۡسِلُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَٰفِظِينَ

data.price: So Today[7] the believers will laugh at the disbelievers,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ يَضۡحَكُونَ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the Day of Judgment.

data.price: while sitting on the couches, gazing around.
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: Have the disbelievers been rewarded except for what they used to do?
data.arabic: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُواْ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: When the sky is rent asunder,
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتۡ

data.price: and hearkens to its Lord[1], as it must,
data.arabic: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ
data.footnotes: [1] In full obedience.

data.price: and when the earth is leveled out[2],
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مُدَّتۡ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., spread out.

data.price: and casts out all what it contains[3], and becomes empty,
data.arabic: وَأَلۡقَتۡ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتۡ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., its dead bodies and treasures buried in it.

data.price: and hearkens to its Lord, as it must,
data.arabic: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ

data.price: O humans, you are toiling towards your Lord[4], and you will surely meet Him[5].
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحٗا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
data.footnotes:
[4] i.e., striving in doing good or evil until you meet your Lord.
 [5] To be recompensed by Him for your deeds.

data.price: Whoever is given his Record in his right hand,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ

data.price: he will have an easy reckoning,
data.arabic: فَسَوۡفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابٗا يَسِيرٗا

data.price: and he will return to his people joyfully.
data.arabic: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورٗا

data.price: But whoever is given his Record from behind his back,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ

data.price: he will call out for destruction,
data.arabic: فَسَوۡفَ يَدۡعُواْ ثُبُورٗا

data.price: and he will enter the Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: وَيَصۡلَىٰ سَعِيرًا

data.price: Indeed, he used to live among his people joyfully.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِيٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورًا

data.price: and he thought that he would never return [to Allah].
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ

data.price: Indeed he will! His Lord was always watching him.
data.arabic: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرٗا

data.price: Indeed, I swear by the twilight,
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ

data.price: and by the night and what it covers,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ

data.price: and by the moon when it becomes full,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ

data.price: You will surely pass from one stage to another[6].
data.arabic: لَتَرۡكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٖ
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., from sperm-drop to clinging clot to lump, from life to death to resurrection.

data.price: Then what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: and when the Qur’an is recited to them, they do not prostrate?
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا يَسۡجُدُونَۤ۩

data.price: Rather, the disbelievers persist in denying it,
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ يُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: but Allah knows best whatever they harbor in their hearts.
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ

data.price: So give them the tidings of a painful punishment.
data.arabic: فَبَشِّرۡهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

data.price: But those who believe and do righteous deeds will have a never-ending reward.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ

data.price: By the sky full of constellations,
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡبُرُوجِ

data.price: and by the promised Day,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡمَوۡعُودِ

data.price: and by the witness and the witnessed,
data.arabic: وَشَاهِدٖ وَمَشۡهُودٖ

data.price: cursed be the makers of the trench[1],
data.arabic: قُتِلَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأُخۡدُودِ
data.footnotes: [1] Those who worked for a tyrannical king and did not allow the people to believe in Allah. Their blind obedience to their ruler incurred upon them the curse of Allah.

data.price: the fire full of fuel,
data.arabic: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡوَقُودِ

data.price: when they sat around it,
data.arabic: إِذۡ هُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا قُعُودٞ

data.price: and were witnessing what they did to the believers[2].
data.arabic: وَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفۡعَلُونَ بِٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ شُهُودٞ
data.footnotes: [2] After the believers were casted into a trench of fire, they sat around it watching them burn to death. It occurred long before Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) time.

data.price: Their only grievance against them was that they believed in Allah, the All-Mighty, the Praiseworthy,
data.arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤۡمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡحَمِيدِ

data.price: to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and Allah is Witness over all things.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ شَهِيدٌ

data.price: Indeed, for those who tortured the believing men and women, and then did not repent, there will be the punishment of Hell and the punishment of the burning fire[3].
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُواْ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمۡ يَتُوبُواْ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ ٱلۡحَرِيقِ
data.footnotes: [3] Those who burned the believers will be punished with the burning fire in the Hereafter.

data.price: But those who believed and did righteous deeds will certainly have gardens under which rivers flow; that is the supreme triumph.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡكَبِيرُ

data.price: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is severe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ بَطۡشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ

data.price: Indeed, it is He Who originates [the creation] and then resurrects all,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبۡدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ

data.price: and He is the All-Forgiving, the Most Affectionate,
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلۡوَدُودُ

data.price: the Lord of the Glorious Throne;
data.arabic: ذُو ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡمَجِيدُ

data.price: He does whatever He wills.
data.arabic: فَعَّالٞ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ

data.price: Has there not come to you the story of the forces
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡجُنُودِ

data.price: of Pharaoh and Thamūd?
data.arabic: فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَثَمُودَ

data.price: But the disbelievers are in persistent denial,
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي تَكۡذِيبٖ

data.price: although Allah encompasses them from all sides.
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِم مُّحِيطُۢ

data.price: But this is a glorious Qur’an,
data.arabic: بَلۡ هُوَ قُرۡءَانٞ مَّجِيدٞ

data.price: [inscribed] in a Preserved Tablet.
data.arabic: فِي لَوۡحٖ مَّحۡفُوظِۭ

data.price: By the sky and the night comer –
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ

data.price: and how do you know what the night comer is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ

data.price: It is the star of piercing brightness[1] –
data.arabic: ٱلنَّجۡمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
data.footnotes: [1] Whose light pierces through the darkness or through the sky.

data.price: there is no soul except that there is a watcher over it.
data.arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ لَّمَّا عَلَيۡهَا حَافِظٞ

data.price: Let man reflect on what he was created from.
data.arabic: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ

data.price: He was created from a spurting fluid,
data.arabic: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٖ دَافِقٖ

data.price: emerging from between the backbone and the ribs[2].
data.arabic: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ ٱلصُّلۡبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ
data.footnotes: [2] Both testes and ovaries are sustained by arteries originating between the backbone and the ribcage.

data.price: Indeed, Allah is able to bring him back to life.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجۡعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٞ

data.price: On the Day when all secrets will be disclosed[3],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تُبۡلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
data.footnotes: [3] The secrets will be examined, disclosing the real intentions and faiths people harbored, distinguishing between righteous and evil therefrom.

data.price: he will then have no power, nor any helper.
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٖ وَلَا نَاصِرٖ

data.price: By the sky and its recurring rain[4],
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجۡعِ
data.footnotes: [4] And sun, moon, stars, clouds, heat, etc.

data.price: and by the earth that cracks open [with the sprout of plants],
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدۡعِ

data.price: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a decisive word,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلٞ فَصۡلٞ

data.price: which is not for amusement.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلۡهَزۡلِ

data.price: Indeed, they are devising a plan.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ يَكِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗا

data.price: I am too devising a plan.
data.arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيۡدٗا

data.price: So bear with the disbelievers, and give them respite for a while[5].
data.arabic: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ أَمۡهِلۡهُمۡ رُوَيۡدَۢا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., Do not be in haste in seeking their punishment and destruction.

data.price: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,
data.arabic: سَبِّحِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡأَعۡلَى

data.price: Who created and fashioned in due proportion,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

data.price: and Who determined [the creation] then inspired them,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ

data.price: and Who brings forth the pasture,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلۡمَرۡعَىٰ

data.price: then makes it into withered chaff.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحۡوَىٰ

data.price: We will teach you [the Qur’an], so you will not forget,
data.arabic: سَنُقۡرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ

data.price: except what Allah wills[1], for indeed He knows what is manifest and what is hidden.
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا يَخۡفَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., except what Allah wills to make you forget for wisdom such as abrogating or replacing a ruling by another.

data.price: We will guide you to the easy way[2].
data.arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [2] To the way of Islam which brings about ease in this life and attainment of Paradise in the Hereafter, or will give you opportunities for righteous deeds that lead to Paradise.

data.price: So remind, if the reminder should benefit[3].
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [3] Wherever this Qur’an will be heard.

data.price: He who fears Allah will take heed,
data.arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: but the wretched will avoid it,
data.arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

data.price: who will enter the Great Fire,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يَصۡلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

data.price: wherein he will neither die nor live.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحۡيَىٰ

data.price: Indeed, he who purifies himself will attain success,
data.arabic: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: and remembers his Lord’s Name and prays.
data.arabic: وَذَكَرَ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ

data.price: But you prefer the life of this world,
data.arabic: بَلۡ تُؤۡثِرُونَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: even though the Hereafter is better and more lasting.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ وَأَبۡقَىٰٓ

data.price: Indeed, this was in the earlier Scriptures,
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
data.arabic: صُحُفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ

data.price: Has there come to you the story of the Overwhelming Event?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡغَٰشِيَةِ

data.price: On that Day, some faces will be humiliated,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ خَٰشِعَةٌ

data.price: overburdened and weary[1],
data.arabic: عَامِلَةٞ نَّاصِبَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1] They will be burdened with the heavy shackles in the Hereafter, or they performed deeds in their worldly life which were bereft of faith or not done for the sake of Allah.

data.price: as they burn in a scorching Fire.
data.arabic: تَصۡلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةٗ

data.price: They will be made to drink from a boiling spring,
data.arabic: تُسۡقَىٰ مِنۡ عَيۡنٍ ءَانِيَةٖ

data.price: and they will have no food except bitter thorny plants,
data.arabic: لَّيۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٖ

data.price: that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.
data.arabic: لَّا يُسۡمِنُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِن جُوعٖ

data.price: Other faces on that Day will be joyful,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاعِمَةٞ

data.price: well-pleased with their past striving,
data.arabic: لِّسَعۡيِهَا رَاضِيَةٞ

data.price: in an elevated garden,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٖ

data.price: wherein no idle talk will be heard[2].
data.arabic: لَّا تَسۡمَعُ فِيهَا لَٰغِيَةٗ
data.footnotes: [2] Rather than an insult, falsehood, immorality, etc.

data.price: There will be a flowing spring;
data.arabic: فِيهَا عَيۡنٞ جَارِيَةٞ

data.price: and couches raised high,
data.arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٞ مَّرۡفُوعَةٞ

data.price: and cups placed ready,
data.arabic: وَأَكۡوَابٞ مَّوۡضُوعَةٞ

data.price: and cushions lined up,
data.arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصۡفُوفَةٞ

data.price: and splendid carpets spread out.
data.arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبۡثُوثَةٌ

data.price: Do they not reflect on the camel, how it is created;
data.arabic: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَيۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ

data.price: and the sky, how it is raised high;
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيۡفَ رُفِعَتۡ

data.price: and the mountains, how they are firmly set up;
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلۡجِبَالِ كَيۡفَ نُصِبَتۡ

data.price: and the earth, how it is spread out?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَيۡفَ سُطِحَتۡ

data.price: So remind [O Prophet]; your duty is only to remind;
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٞ

data.price: you are not assigned to compel them.
data.arabic: لَّسۡتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِمُصَيۡطِرٍ

data.price: But whoever turns away and disbelieves,
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ

data.price: Allah will inflict upon him the greatest punishment[3].
data.arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرَ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., the greatest punishment is the Hellfire. The minor punishment includes disasters in worldly life and grave punishment.

data.price: Indeed, to Us is their return,
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيۡنَآ إِيَابَهُمۡ

data.price: then it is for Us to call them to account.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا حِسَابَهُم

data.price: By the dawn,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡفَجۡرِ

data.price: and the ten nights[1],
data.arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشۡرٖ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the first ten nights of the lunar month of Dhul-Hijjah.

data.price: and the even and the odd[2],
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّفۡعِ وَٱلۡوَتۡرِ
data.footnotes: [2] Of the things.

data.price: and by the night when it comes,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَسۡرِ

data.price: are these oaths not sufficient for those who have sense?
data.arabic: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ

data.price: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

data.price: of Iram[3], who were people of great stature,
data.arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ
data.footnotes: [3] Iram: an ancient tribe; or a well-known tribe in Yemen; or the grandfather of the people of ‘Aad, etc. Prophet Hūd was sent to the people of ‘Aad.

data.price: the like of whom had never been created in the land;
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: and Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the Valley;
data.arabic: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُواْ ٱلصَّخۡرَ بِٱلۡوَادِ

data.price: and the mighty and powerful[4] Pharaoh?
data.arabic: وَفِرۡعَوۡنَ ذِي ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ
data.footnotes: [4] Or the owner of the stakes by which he used to torture people.

data.price: All of them transgressed in the land,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: and spread therein much corruption,
data.arabic: فَأَكۡثَرُواْ فِيهَا ٱلۡفَسَادَ

data.price: so your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
data.arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّكَ سَوۡطَ عَذَابٍ

data.price: Indeed, your Lord is ever vigilant.
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلۡمِرۡصَادِ

data.price: As for man, when he is tested by his Lord by honoring him and bestowing blessings upon him, he says, “My Lord has [deservedly] honored me[5]!”
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ
data.footnotes: [5] Instead of being grateful, he is proud, attributing the favor to his own merit.

data.price: But when he is tested by restricting his provision, he says, “My Lord has [undeservedly] humiliated me!”
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ

data.price: No indeed[6]! You are not kind to the orphan,
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا تُكۡرِمُونَ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ
data.footnotes: [6] It is not as you think. Allah puts people to test through prosperity and hardship and rewards their gratitude and patience in the Hereafter.

data.price: nor do you urge one another to feed the needy,
data.arabic: وَلَا تَحَٰٓضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ

data.price: and you greedily consume the entire inheritance[7],
data.arabic: وَتَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكۡلٗا لَّمّٗا
data.footnotes: [7] Whether lawful or unlawful.

data.price: and love wealth immensely.
data.arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡمَالَ حُبّٗا جَمّٗا

data.price: No indeed! When the earth is crushed over and over,
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا

data.price: and your Lord comes[8] with the angels, rank after rank,
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلۡمَلَكُ صَفّٗا صَفّٗا
data.footnotes: [8] To pass judgment between people.

data.price: and Hell is brought near on that Day – this is when man will understand, but what is the use of that understanding?
data.arabic: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

data.price: He will say, “Would that I had sent forth something for my [eternal] life!”
data.arabic: يَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي قَدَّمۡتُ لِحَيَاتِي

data.price: None can punish as He punishes on that Day,
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ

data.price: and none can bind as He binds.
data.arabic: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ

data.price: [It will be said to the believer,] “O the tranquil soul!
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفۡسُ ٱلۡمُطۡمَئِنَّةُ

data.price: Return to your Lord, well pleased and pleasing [to Him].
data.arabic: ٱرۡجِعِيٓ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةٗ مَّرۡضِيَّةٗ

data.price: Join My [righteous] slaves,
data.arabic: فَٱدۡخُلِي فِي عِبَٰدِي

data.price: and enter My Paradise.”
data.arabic: وَٱدۡخُلِي جَنَّتِي

data.price: I do swear by this city [of Makkah] –
data.arabic: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ

data.price: and you are free of restriction [for a while] in this city[1] –
data.arabic: وَأَنتَ حِلُّۢ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ
data.footnotes: [1] To punish the enemies of Islam on the Conquest Day.

data.price: and by every parent[2] and his offspring,
data.arabic: وَوَالِدٖ وَمَا وَلَدَ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., Adam.

data.price: We have created man in hardship.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِي كَبَدٍ

data.price: Does he think that none can ever have power over him?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقۡدِرَ عَلَيۡهِ أَحَدٞ

data.price: He says, “I have squandered enormous wealth!”
data.arabic: يَقُولُ أَهۡلَكۡتُ مَالٗا لُّبَدًا

data.price: Does he think that no one sees him?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّمۡ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ

data.price: Have We not given him two eyes,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ عَيۡنَيۡنِ

data.price: and a tongue and two lips,
data.arabic: وَلِسَانٗا وَشَفَتَيۡنِ

data.price: and shown him the two ways [of right and wrong]?
data.arabic: وَهَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلنَّجۡدَيۡنِ

data.price: Yet he did not make his way through the steep path[3],
data.arabic: فَلَا ٱقۡتَحَمَ ٱلۡعَقَبَةَ
data.footnotes: [3] He did not spend for the sake of Allah but to show off.

data.price: and how do you know what the steep path is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡعَقَبَةُ

data.price: It is freeing a slave,
data.arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ

data.price: or giving food on a day of hunger,
data.arabic: أَوۡ إِطۡعَٰمٞ فِي يَوۡمٖ ذِي مَسۡغَبَةٖ

data.price: to an orphan relative,
data.arabic: يَتِيمٗا ذَا مَقۡرَبَةٍ

data.price: or to a needy person in misery,
data.arabic: أَوۡ مِسۡكِينٗا ذَا مَتۡرَبَةٖ

data.price: then [most importantly] to be one of those who believe and exhort one another to patience and exhort one another to compassion.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ

data.price: Such are the people of the Right[4].
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., those who receive the records of their deeds in the right hand and proceed to Paradise.

data.price: As for those who reject Our signs, they are the people of the Left[5],
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., those who receive the records of their deeds in the left hand and proceed to Hellfire.

data.price: who will be locked up in the Fire.
data.arabic: عَلَيۡهِمۡ نَارٞ مُّؤۡصَدَةُۢ

data.price: By the sun and its brightness,
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّمۡسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا

data.price: and by the moon as it follows it[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., appears after the sun disappears.

data.price: and by the day as it displays it[2],
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., the earth or the sun.

data.price: and by the night as it covers it[3],
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., the earth or the sun.

data.price: and by the sky and how He made it,
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا

data.price: and by the earth and how He spread it,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا

data.price: and by the soul and how He fashioned it[4],
data.arabic: وَنَفۡسٖ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [4] By sound natural disposition.

data.price: then inspired it [to know] its wickedness and righteousness,
data.arabic: فَأَلۡهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقۡوَىٰهَا

data.price: Indeed, he who purifies his soul will attain success,
data.arabic: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا

data.price: and he who corrupts it will be doomed.
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا

data.price: Thamūd rejected [the messenger] because of their transgression,
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِطَغۡوَىٰهَآ

data.price: when the most wretched among them rose[5].
data.arabic: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشۡقَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [5] To kill the camel that Allah sent as a miracle to them.

data.price: Although the messenger of Allah warned them, “Hands off the she-camel of Allah and her drink!”
data.arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا

data.price: Yet they rejected him and hamstrung her[6]. So their Lord destroyed them for their sin and leveled them to the ground.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [6] And then killed her.

data.price: And He has no fear of the consequences thereof[7].
data.arabic: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقۡبَٰهَا
data.footnotes: [7] Allah is not asked for what He does, but His slaves will be asked. See 21:23

data.price: By the night when it covers[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1] Everything between sky and earth with its darkness.

data.price: and by the day when it appears,
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ

data.price: and by His creation of male and female,
data.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ

data.price: surely your efforts are divergent.
data.arabic: إِنَّ سَعۡيَكُمۡ لَشَتَّىٰ

data.price: As for the one who gives in charity and fears Allah,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أَعۡطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ

data.price: and truly believes in the best reward,
data.arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

data.price: We will make easy for him the way of salvation.
data.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: But as for the one who is miserly and deems himself self-sufficient,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ

data.price: and denies the best reward,
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

data.price: We will make easy for him the way of perdition.
data.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡعُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: His wealth will be of no avail to him when he tumbles [into Hell].
data.arabic: وَمَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ

data.price: Indeed, it is upon Us to show the right way,
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا لَلۡهُدَىٰ

data.price: and surely to Us belong the Hereafter and the present life.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلۡأٓخِرَةَ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: So I warn you of a raging Fire,
data.arabic: فَأَنذَرۡتُكُمۡ نَارٗا تَلَظَّىٰ

data.price: none will enter it except the most wretched,
data.arabic: لَا يَصۡلَىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

data.price: who denied and turned away.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: But the most righteous will be saved from it,
data.arabic: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَتۡقَى

data.price: who spends his wealth to purify himself,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يُؤۡتِي مَالَهُۥ يَتَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: not in return for someone’s favors[2],
data.arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةٖ تُجۡزَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., not as a repayment for a favor he received.

data.price: but to seek the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ وَجۡهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: He will surely be well pleased.
data.arabic: وَلَسَوۡفَ يَرۡضَىٰ

data.price: By the morning sunlight,
data.arabic: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ

data.price: and by the night when it covers with darkness[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1] And everything becomes still.

data.price: your Lord has neither forsaken you [O Prophet] nor hated you;
data.arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ

data.price: the Hereafter is better for you than the present life;
data.arabic: وَلَلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: and your Lord will certainly give you so much that you will be well pleased.
data.arabic: وَلَسَوۡفَ يُعۡطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرۡضَىٰٓ

data.price: Did He not find you an orphan then take good care of you?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجِدۡكَ يَتِيمٗا فَـَٔاوَىٰ

data.price: Did He not find you unguided then guide you?
data.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلّٗا فَهَدَىٰ

data.price: Did He not find you in need then enrich you?
data.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلٗا فَأَغۡنَىٰ

data.price: So do not mistreat the orphan,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقۡهَرۡ

data.price: nor repulse the beggar[2];
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنۡهَرۡ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., anyone in need who seeks help.

data.price: and proclaim the favors of your Lord[3].
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثۡ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., be grateful to Allah by proclaiming the favors He has given you.

data.price: Have We not reassured your heart for you [O Prophet][1],
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَشۡرَحۡ لَكَ صَدۡرَكَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., enlighten and gladden your heart for receiving the revelation.

data.price: and relieved you of your burden[2]
data.arabic: وَوَضَعۡنَا عَنكَ وِزۡرَكَ
data.footnotes: [2] forgave your previous or future errors, or relieved you of the anxiety you experienced at the beginning of your mission.

data.price: that weighed down your back,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهۡرَكَ

data.price: and raised high your fame for you[3]?
data.arabic: وَرَفَعۡنَا لَكَ ذِكۡرَكَ
data.footnotes: [3] Allah raised the Prophet's name in numerous ways, such as his name is mentioned twice in the call to prayer five times a day, as well the second call to prayer; at the end of each of the five daily prayers; believers invoke Allah’s blessings upon him and his family; and upon reverting to Islam, his name is mentioned, etc.

data.price: For indeed, with hardship comes ease[4],
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرًا
data.footnotes: [4] In Arabic grammar, if a definite noun is repeated, it is referring to the same thing. However, if an indefinite noun is repeated, it is referring to two different things. So here in this and the coming verse they refer to one hardship (a definite noun) and two eases (an indefinite noun), which manifests Allah's favors upon His servants even in times of hardships.

data.price: indeed, with hardship comes ease.
data.arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرٗا

data.price: So whenever you are free[5], strive in worship,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغۡتَ فَٱنصَبۡ
data.footnotes: [5] Of your duties.

data.price: and turn to your Lord in devotion.
data.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرۡغَب

data.price: By the fig and the olive[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيۡتُونِ
data.footnotes: [1] Of Jerusalem.

data.price: and by Mount Sinai[2],
data.arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
data.footnotes: [2] Of Egypt.

data.price: and by this secure city [of Makkah][3],
data.arabic: وَهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ٱلۡأَمِينِ
data.footnotes: [3] This passage refers to the land of the three great prophets of Allah: Jesus (ﷺ) lived in the land of figs and olives, Moses (ﷺ) communicated with Allah on Mount Sinai, and Muhammad's (ﷺ) birthplace was Makkah. There is a similar reference in Deuteronomy 33:1, [Moses said:] “The Lord came from Sinai. Rising from Seir upon us, and he shone forth from Mount Paran.” Seir is a mountain near Jerusalem, and Paran is a mountain near Makkah.

data.price: Surely We have created man in the best form[4],
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., in upright and balanced form and nature.

data.price: then We will reduce him to the lowest of the low[5],
data.arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدۡنَٰهُ أَسۡفَلَ سَٰفِلِينَ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., to the depths of Hell due to deviation from uprightness; or to decrepit old age.

data.price: except those who believe and do righteous deeds; they will have a never-ending reward.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ

data.price: Then, what makes you deny the Judgment Day?
data.arabic: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعۡدُ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: Is not Allah the Most Just of all judges?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحۡكَمِ ٱلۡحَٰكِمِينَ

data.price: Read in the name of your Lord Who created,
data.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ

data.price: created man from a clinging clot.
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِنۡ عَلَقٍ

data.price: Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous,
data.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلۡأَكۡرَمُ

data.price: Who taught by the pen,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِٱلۡقَلَمِ

data.price: taught man what he did not know[1].
data.arabic: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مَا لَمۡ يَعۡلَمۡ
data.footnotes: [1] These five verses (1-5) are the first ever verses revealed of the Qur’an. The Prophet (ﷺ) was retreating at a cave in the outskirts of Makkah when the angel Gabriel appeared before him, and ordered him to read. Since the Prophet (ﷺ) was unlettered, he would respond, “I cannot read.” Gabriel would then squeeze him tightly and order him again to read. Ultimately, Gabriel said to him: “Read in the name of your Lord …”.

data.price: Indeed, man transgresses
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَيَطۡغَىٰٓ

data.price: when he deems himself to be self-sufficient.
data.arabic: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰٓ

data.price: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجۡعَىٰٓ

data.price: Have you seen the one who prevents[2]
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يَنۡهَىٰ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., Abu Jahl was a pagan leader of the Makkah who was an arch-enemy of Islam.

data.price: a slave [of Allah] from praying[3]?
data.arabic: عَبۡدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [3] Abu Jahl abused the Prophet (ﷺ) when he prayed in the Holy Mosque.

data.price: What if this [slave] is rightly guided,
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ

data.price: and enjoins righteousness?
data.arabic: أَوۡ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقۡوَىٰٓ

data.price: How about the one who denies and turns away[4]?
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [4] From what the Prophet (ﷺ) has brought and does he not fear Allah?

data.price: Does he not know that Allah is watching all?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَعۡلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرَىٰ

data.price: No indeed; if he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock[5]
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمۡ يَنتَهِ لَنَسۡفَعَۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [5] To the Hellfire.

data.price: a lying, sinful forelock[6].
data.arabic: نَاصِيَةٖ كَٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٖ
data.footnotes: [6] It alludes to the frontal lobe of the brain, where reasoning is processed.

data.price: So let him call his associates;
data.arabic: فَلۡيَدۡعُ نَادِيَهُۥ

data.price: We will call the wardens of Hellfire[7].
data.arabic: سَنَدۡعُ ٱلزَّبَانِيَةَ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the coarse, rigorous, and harsh angels assigned for the Hellfire.

data.price: No indeed; do not obey him, but prostrate and draw near [to Allah].
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعۡهُ وَٱسۡجُدۡۤ وَٱقۡتَرِب۩

data.price: Indeed, We sent this [Qur’an] down on the Night of Decree[1].
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ فِي لَيۡلَةِ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ
data.footnotes: [1] The Qur’an was first revealed completely to the lowest heaven on this night. Also, its revelation on the Prophet (ﷺ) started on this night.

data.price: How do you know what the Night of Decree is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ

data.price: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
data.arabic: لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أَلۡفِ شَهۡرٖ

data.price: On that night the angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] descend by their Lord’s permission with all decrees[2].
data.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذۡنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمۡرٖ
data.footnotes: [2] Bringing down the exact provisions, life, death, and other things destined for the creatures for the coming year by Allah's permission.

data.price: It is all peace[3] until the break of dawn.
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطۡلَعِ ٱلۡفَجۡرِ
data.footnotes: [3] Upon the believers.

data.price: Those who disbelieve from the People of the Book and the polytheists were not going to desist [from disbelief][1] until there came to them clear proof,
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأۡتِيَهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., and from deviant ways.

data.price: a messenger from Allah, reciting pure pages[2]
data.arabic: رَسُولٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتۡلُواْ صُحُفٗا مُّطَهَّرَةٗ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., that contains no falsehood.

data.price: containing upright commandments.
data.arabic: فِيهَا كُتُبٞ قَيِّمَةٞ

data.price: Yet those who were given the Scripture did not disagree[3] except after the clear proof came to them,
data.arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
data.footnotes: [3] Into different sects and denominations.

data.price: although they were commanded only to worship Allah with sincere devotion to Him, being inclined to the true faith, and to establish prayer and give zakah; that is the true religion.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓاْ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤۡتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلۡقَيِّمَةِ

data.price: Those who disbelieve from the People of the Book and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding therein forever. It is they who are the worst of creatures.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ شَرُّ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ

data.price: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds – it is they who are the best of creatures.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ

data.price: Their reward with their Lord is Gardens of Eternity under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. This is for those who fear their Lord.
data.arabic: جَزَآؤُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتُ عَدۡنٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدٗاۖ رَّضِيَ ٱللَّهُ عَنۡهُمۡ وَرَضُواْ عَنۡهُۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنۡ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُۥ

data.price: When the earth is shaken with a mighty quake,
data.arabic: إِذَا زُلۡزِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ زِلۡزَالَهَا

data.price: and the earth throws out its burdens[1],
data.arabic: وَأَخۡرَجَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ أَثۡقَالَهَا
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., its dead bodies and treasures.

data.price: and man says[2], “What is the matter with it?”
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا لَهَا
data.footnotes: [2] In terror and astonishment.

data.price: On that Day it will recount all its news,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُحَدِّثُ أَخۡبَارَهَا

data.price: because your Lord has inspired it [to do so].
data.arabic: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوۡحَىٰ لَهَا

data.price: On that Day all people will come forward in separate groups to be shown their deeds[3].
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَصۡدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشۡتَاتٗا لِّيُرَوۡاْ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ
data.footnotes:
[3] From the place of Judgment to see the consequences of their deeds, whether to Paradise or to Hell.
 [MMCXIII]

data.price: So whoever does an atom’s weight[4] of good will see it,
data.arabic: فَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيۡرٗا يَرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [4] Or a small ant’s weight.

data.price: and whoever does an atom’s weight of evil will see it.
data.arabic: وَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٖ شَرّٗا يَرَهُۥ

data.price: By the galloping, panting horses[1],
data.arabic: وَٱلۡعَٰدِيَٰتِ ضَبۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., those horses that fight for the cause of Allah as they race to attack the enemy.

data.price: striking sparks of fire [with their hooves][2],
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُورِيَٰتِ قَدۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [2] While galloping over rocky terrain.

data.price: launching raids at dawn[3],
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُغِيرَٰتِ صُبۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [3] While the enemy is unaware of their raid.

data.price: stirring up thereby clouds of dust,
data.arabic: فَأَثَرۡنَ بِهِۦ نَقۡعٗا

data.price: plunging thereby into the midst of the enemy[4],
data.arabic: فَوَسَطۡنَ بِهِۦ جَمۡعًا
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., penetrating into the ranks of the enemy as a surprise attack.

data.price: indeed, man is very ungrateful to his Lord[5] –
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودٞ
data.footnotes: [5] disobeying Him by not spending in the cause of Allah from what He has given him and commanded him to spend accordingly.

data.price: and he himself is a witness to that[6] –
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٞ
data.footnotes: [6] By his words and actions.

data.price: and he is truly extreme in his love of wealth.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلۡخَيۡرِ لَشَدِيدٌ

data.price: Does he not know that when the contents of graves will be overturned,
data.arabic: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعۡلَمُ إِذَا بُعۡثِرَ مَا فِي ٱلۡقُبُورِ

data.price: and the secrets of the hearts will be brought to light[7]?
data.arabic: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي ٱلصُّدُورِ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., when all secrets of the hearts and faiths are made known.

data.price: Indeed, their Lord is All-Aware of them on that Day[8].
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّخَبِيرُۢ
data.footnotes: [8] Nothing of their affairs will be hidden from Him.

data.price: The Striking Calamity!
data.arabic: ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: What is the Striking Calamity?
data.arabic: مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: How do you know what the Striking Calamity is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: On that Day people will be like scattered moths[1],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلۡفَرَاشِ ٱلۡمَبۡثُوثِ
data.footnotes: [1] After having been thrown out of their graves.

data.price: and the mountains will be like carded wool[2].
data.arabic: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ ٱلۡمَنفُوشِ
data.footnotes: [2] As they disintegrate.

data.price: Then the one whose scales of good deeds are heavy,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ

data.price: will have a pleasant life[3].
data.arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٖ رَّاضِيَةٖ
data.footnotes: [3] In Paradise.

data.price: But the one whose scales of good deeds are light,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَفَّتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ

data.price: his abode will be the abyss[4].
data.arabic: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِيَةٞ
data.footnotes: [4] Hāwiyah: the pit of Hellfire.

data.price: And how do you know what it is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا هِيَهۡ

data.price: It is a Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: نَارٌ حَامِيَةُۢ

data.price: Competition for worldly gains distracts you [from Allah],
data.arabic: أَلۡهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ

data.price: until you come to your graves.
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰ زُرۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَقَابِرَ

data.price: No indeed! You will come to know.
data.arabic: كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: Again no! You will come to know.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: No indeed! If only you knew for certain[1].
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عِلۡمَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
data.footnotes: [1] The conclusion of this verse, "...you would not have been distracted from preparing for the Hereafter by wealth and children."

data.price: You will surely see the Blazing Fire,
data.arabic: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ

data.price: Again, you will see it with absolute certainty.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيۡنَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ

data.price: Then on that Day you will surely be asked about your worldly pleasures[2].
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَتُسۡـَٔلُنَّ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., of health and wealth and other comforts of the worldly life.

data.price: By the time,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡعَصۡرِ

data.price: man is in utter loss,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَفِي خُسۡرٍ

data.price: except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and exhort one another to the truth and exhort one another to patience.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ

data.price: Woe to every backbiter and slanderer,
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٖ لُّمَزَةٍ

data.price: who amasses wealth and counts it over and again[1],
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالٗا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1] Instead of spending in the way of Allah.

data.price: thinking that his wealth will make him live forever.
data.arabic: يَحۡسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥٓ أَخۡلَدَهُۥ

data.price: No indeed! He will surely be cast into the Crushing Fire[2],
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ لَيُنۢبَذَنَّ فِي ٱلۡحُطَمَةِ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., Hellfire, as it crushes and destroys all that is thrown in it.

data.price: and how do you know what the Crushing Fire is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحُطَمَةُ

data.price: It is the kindled Fire of Allah,
data.arabic: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُوقَدَةُ

data.price: which reaches the hearts[3].
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةِ
data.footnotes: [3] Penetrating through bodies and reaching the hearts.

data.price: It will be closed down upon them,
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا عَلَيۡهِم مُّؤۡصَدَةٞ

data.price: locked with towering columns[4].
data.arabic: فِي عَمَدٖ مُّمَدَّدَةِۭ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., columns of fire or columns of iron to which the inmates of Hell are chained.

data.price: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the Elephant[1]?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡفِيلِ
data.footnotes: [1] The army of Abrahah al-Ashram was accompanied by a huge elephant who came with the intention of demolishing the Kaʿba.

data.price: Did He not turn their scheme into a total loss[2]?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجۡعَلۡ كَيۡدَهُمۡ فِي تَضۡلِيلٖ
data.footnotes: [2] Leading them to perish.

data.price: He sent against them swarms of birds,
data.arabic: وَأَرۡسَلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ طَيۡرًا أَبَابِيلَ

data.price: pelting them with stones of baked clay,
data.arabic: تَرۡمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٖ مِّن سِجِّيلٖ

data.price: leaving them like chewed-up chaff.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ كَعَصۡفٖ مَّأۡكُولِۭ

data.price: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1],
data.arabic: لِإِيلَٰفِ قُرَيۡشٍ
data.footnotes: [1] Allah had given Quraysh the honor of being guardians of the Holy Ka‘bah, which allowed them to travel in peace without fear of being harmed.

data.price: secure in their winter and summer journeys[2].
data.arabic: إِۦلَٰفِهِمۡ رِحۡلَةَ ٱلشِّتَآءِ وَٱلصَّيۡفِ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., their trading caravans would travel south to Yemen in winter and north to the Levant in summer.

data.price: Let them worship the Lord of this [Sacred] House[3],
data.arabic: فَلۡيَعۡبُدُواْ رَبَّ هَٰذَا ٱلۡبَيۡتِ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., the Ka‘bah.

data.price: Who fed them against hunger and made them secure against fear[4].
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ
data.footnotes: [4] The people of Quraysh were blessed with provision and security probably because of the prayer of Abraham. See 14:35-37

data.price: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: Such is the one who repulses the orphan harshly,
data.arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ ٱلَّذِي يَدُعُّ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ

data.price: and does not urge others to feed the needy.
data.arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ

data.price: So woe to those who pray,
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُصَلِّينَ

data.price: but are heedless of their prayer[1];
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَن صَلَاتِهِمۡ سَاهُونَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the hypocrites who do not pray except to show off and others who are heedless to pray at their specified times.

data.price: those who only show off,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ يُرَآءُونَ

data.price: and withhold even the small kindnesses.
data.arabic: وَيَمۡنَعُونَ ٱلۡمَاعُونَ

data.price: We have surely given you [O Prophet] al-Kauthar [i.e., abundance][1],
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡطَيۡنَٰكَ ٱلۡكَوۡثَرَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., abundance, of which is the river of al-Kauthar in Paradise.

data.price: so pray and offer sacrifice to your Lord alone.
data.arabic: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنۡحَرۡ

data.price: Indeed, the one who hates you is truly cut off [from all goodness][2].
data.arabic: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلۡأَبۡتَرُ
data.footnotes: [2] Both in this world and in the Hereafter.

data.price: Say, “O disbelievers,
data.arabic: قُلۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ

data.price: I do not worship what you worship,
data.arabic: لَآ أَعۡبُدُ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: nor do you worship what I worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ

data.price: Never will I worship what you worship,
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنَا۠ عَابِدٞ مَّا عَبَدتُّمۡ

data.price: nor will you ever worship what I worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ

data.price: You have your religion and I have my religion."
data.arabic: لَكُمۡ دِينُكُمۡ وَلِيَ دِينِ

data.price: When there comes Allah’s help and the conquest[1],
data.arabic: إِذَا جَآءَ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡفَتۡحُ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the conquest of Makkah.

data.price: and you see people entering Allah’s religion in multitudes,
data.arabic: وَرَأَيۡتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدۡخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفۡوَاجٗا

data.price: then glorify the praise of your Lord, and ask His forgiveness. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرۡهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابَۢا

data.price: May the hands of Abu Lahab[1] perish, and may he perish!
data.arabic: تَبَّتۡ يَدَآ أَبِي لَهَبٖ وَتَبَّ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the Prophet's uncle, who was one of the staunchest enemies of Islam.

data.price: Neither his wealth nor his worldly gains will avail him.
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ

data.price: He will burn in a Flaming Fire,
data.arabic: سَيَصۡلَىٰ نَارٗا ذَاتَ لَهَبٖ

data.price: and so will his wife[2], the carrier of firewood,
data.arabic: وَٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلۡحَطَبِ
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., ’Um Jamīl, who used to throw thorny branches in the Prophet's way and she used to slander him (ﷺ). The word hatab (firewood) was used by the Arabs to allude to slander and backbiting.

data.price: around her neck will be a rope of palm fiber[3].
data.arabic: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبۡلٞ مِّن مَّسَدِۭ
data.footnotes: [3] This surah was one of the earliest surahs revealed in Makkah, yet Abu Lahab persisted in disbelief. For him to disprove the Qur’an, all he had to do was to accept Islam, for the Qur’an condemned him to Hell.

data.price: Say: “He is Allah, the One[1];
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
data.footnotes: [1] He is Alone, without a partner, indivisible and distinct from all else. The only true deity, unique in His essence, attributes, and actions.

data.price: Allah, the Eternal Refuge[2].
data.arabic: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ
data.footnotes: [2] He is absolute, perfect, complete, self-sufficient; the one eternally and constantly required and sought; all existence depend upon Him; all matters ultimately return to Him.

data.price: He neither begets nor is He begotten,
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَلِدۡ وَلَمۡ يُولَدۡ

data.price: and there is none comparable to Him.”[3]
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدُۢ
data.footnotes: [3] The Prophet (ﷺ) says that reading this surah (surat al-Ikhlās) equals reading one third of the Qur’an. [Al-Bukhāri and Muslim]

data.price: Say, “I seek refuge with the Lord of the daybreak,
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡفَلَقِ

data.price: from the harm of all what He has created;
data.arabic: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

data.price: from the harm of darkening [night] when it spreads around,
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ

data.price: from the harm of the sorceresses[1] who blow on knots,
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِي ٱلۡعُقَدِ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., magicians.

data.price: and from the harm of the envier when he envies."
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ

data.price: Say, “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind,
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: the Sovereign of mankind[1],
data.arabic: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the King of mankind.

data.price: the God of mankind,
data.arabic: إِلَٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: from the harm of the lurking whisperer[2],
data.arabic: مِن شَرِّ ٱلۡوَسۡوَاسِ ٱلۡخَنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: [2] Which disappears when one remembers Allah.

data.price: who whispers into the hearts of mankind,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يُوَسۡوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: from among jinn and mankind[3].”
data.arabic: مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: [3] Evil prompters and whisperers can be from jinn or from men.
